eng: Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage
xho: Iyantlukwano, iimbono ezitsha ziyasetyenziswa kuMbindi Mpuma

eng: Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism.
xho: U-Natalia Sancha ebesoloko esamkela indlela yokusebenzisana kubuntatheli.

eng: When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.
xho: Xa eyokwenza umsebenzi wakhe ngaphandle, uthetha nabanye abagubungela ibali elifanayo ngeembono zabo.

eng: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.
xho: Oku ngokuyinxenye kuvela kumdla wokubalisa amabali angabaliswayo ngokwaneleyo, kodwa njengentatheli yasethyini kwindawo elawulwa ngamadoda, uthi intsebenziswano kunye nokuxhasa amanina asebenza nawo ibisoloko ibalulekile.

eng: I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story, the 42-year-old journalist said.
xho: “Bendikhe ndithethe neentatheli zamadoda nabasetyhini, kwaye bendisoloko ndiqaphela ukuba abasetyhini banembono efanayo, kuba nathi besinamava afanayo ngelixa sibhala eli bali,” yatsho intatheli eneminyaka engama-42 ubudala.

eng: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.
xho: Le ndlela yokusebenzisana yaqala ukusebenza ngo-2020 xa umvakalisi wabuza uSancha ukuba unomdla wokubhala incwadi ngeSyria.

eng: She countered with a better offer.
xho: Wachasa enombono olungcono.

eng: I told him that a collective narrative by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect, she said.
xho: “Ndimxelele ukuba ibali elidityanelweyo leentatheli zabasetyhini malunga nommandla obanzi lingaba nefuthe elahlukileyo,” utshilo.

eng: I could have written the book myself, but it would not have the same sense.
xho: Ngendiyibhale ngokwam le ncwadi, kodwa ayinakuba nengqiqo efanayo.

eng: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.
xho: Onemvelaphi yaseAndalusia kumazantsi eSpain, uSancha uchithe iminyaka eli-14 edlulileyo kuMbindi Mpuma egubungela ungquzulwano eIraq, eSyria naseYemen, kwaye enika ingxelo eseEgypt, eLebhanon naseTunisia.

eng: She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following a mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020.
xho: Usebenze kutsha nje nesebe lezonxibelelwano le-European Union, emva kokushiya i-Beirut ngenxa yezizathu zempilo kulandela ugqabhuko-dubulo olukhulu olwanyakamisa isixeko ngo-2020.

eng: Women "have a different experience because we would go to places that our male colleagues were not used to.
xho: Abasetyhini “banamava ahlukileyo kuba besisiya kwiindawo abangaziqhelanga oogxa bethu abangamadoda.

eng: Not because we're smarter, but just because the majority of the region is still Arab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.
xho: Hay ngenxa yokuba sihlakaniphile, kodwa ngenxa yokuba uninzi lwalo mmandla lusengama-Arabhu, amaSilamsi kunye nolwahlulo ngokwesini, "uSancha uxelele iVOA.

eng: Having women reporters has an impact, she noted.
xho: Ukuba neentatheli zabasetyhini kunempembelelo, waphawula.

eng: If I put myself in the position of the reader, I would prefer to have a woman telling me the story because it is going to be about 100 percent of the population, which means you are going to have a more inclusive narrative on the conflict.
xho: Ukuba ndizibeka kwindawo yomfundi, ndingathanda ukuba nomntu wasetyhini ondixelela ibali kuba liza kuba malunga ne-100 yepesenti yabemi, oku kuthetha ukuba uya kuba nengxelo ebandakanya ngakumbi kwingxabano. .

eng: For her book, Sancha reached out to other women who cover the Middle East, to ensure diverse perspectives from foreign and local reporters.
xho: Kwincwadi yakhe, u-Sancha wafikelela kwabanye abafazi abagubungela uMbindi Mpuma, ukuqinisekisa iimbono ezahlukeneyo ezivela kwiintatheli zangaphandle kunye nezasekhaya.

eng: The result of the nearly two-year collaboration is Bullets for All, released in Spanish in April.
xho: Isiphumo sentsebenziswano ephantse ibe yiminyaka emibini yiBullets for All, ekhutshwe ngeSpanish ngoAprili.

eng: In the book, "we tell one story with different voices that represent all the women" from the region, Sancha said.
xho: Kulencwadi, "sibalisa ibali elinye ngamazwi ahlukeneyo amele bonke abafazi" bendawo, utshilo uSancha.

eng: Each offers a personal perspective on covering historic moments, including the collapse of autocratic governments, popular protest movements and war.
xho: Nganye ibonelela ngembono yobuqu malunga nokugubungela amaxesha embali, kubandakanya ukuwa koorhulumente bolawulo-melo, intshukumo yoqhanqalazo edumileyo kunye nemfazwe.

eng: It also examines the discrimination and harassment women face in the newsroom and on assignment.
xho: Ikwavavanya ucalucalulo kunye nokuxhatshazwa kwabasetyhini abajongana nabo kwigumbi leendaba nakwizabelo.

eng: Understanding language and culture goes a long way toward making progress in the region, says Maya Gebeily.
xho: UMaya Gebeily uthi ukuqonda ulwimi nenkcubeko kunegalelo elikhulu ekwenzeni inkqubela kulo mmandla.

eng: The Reuters bureau chief for Lebanon, Syria and Jordan is one of the contributors to the book.
xho: Umphathi we-Reuters Bureau yeLebhanon, iSyria kunye neJordani ngomnye wabanegalelo kule ncwadi.

eng: There's a lot to say and show from the perspective of women reporters who were also then influenced by the women that they met as they were doing their reporting, she said.
xho: “Kuninzi okuthethwa nokuboniswa ngokwembono yeentathezli zasethyini nazo ezithi ziphenjelelwe ngamakhosikazi athe zadibana nawo ngethuba zisenza ingxelo,” utshilo.

eng: Born in the U.S. to Lebanese parents, Gebeily started her journalism career in 2013 with a local news site in Beirut, Lebanon. She went on to cover the region for Agence France-Presse before joining Reuters.
xho: Ozalelwe e-US kubazali baseLibanon, uGebeily waqala umsebenzi wakhe wobuntatheli ngo-2013 kwindawo yeendaba yasekhaya eBeirut, eLibanon. Uqhubekile nokugubungela ummandla we-Agence France-Presse ngaphambi kokujoyina iReuters.

eng: Gebeily said her American and Lebanese background helped her understand the region better, which in turn has shaped her reporting.
xho: UGebeily uthe imvelaphi yakhe yaseMelika kunye neLibanon yamnceda ukuba awuqonde ngcono ummandla, nto leyo eye yabumba ingxelo yakhe.

eng: Knowing the local language is an important part of that.
xho: Ukwazi ulwimi lwasekuhlaleni yinxalenye ebalulekileyo yoko.

eng: When interviewing a minister or a displaced person or an activist, the most important element is getting their trust, she said.
xho: “Xa unodliwano-ndlebe nomphathiswa okanye umntu oshiye ikhaya okanye itshantliziyo, eyona nto ibalulekileyo kukufumana ukuthenjwa ngabo,” utshilo.

eng: If you're able to speak the language and make them feel comfortable from the beginning, it changes everything.
xho: Ukuba uyakwazi ukuthetha ulwimi kwaye ubenze bazive bekhululekile kwasekuqaleni, oko kutshintsha yonke into.

eng: It grants you a very beautiful kind of access.
xho: Ikunika uhlobo oluhle kakhulu lokufikelela. "

eng: In addition to Iraq and Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, has also traveled to Syria to cover the war against the Islamic State (IS) militant group.
xho: Ukongeza e-Iraq naseLebhanon, uGebeily, oneminyaka engama-30 ubudala, naye uye waya eSyria ukuze apapashe imfazwe echasene neqela le-Islamic State (IS).

eng: Ive been very privileged to access some communities directly without having to work with a translator or a fixer, which also shapes the way that the stories come out, she said.
xho: “Ndibe nenyhweba yokufikelela kwiindawo ezithile zoluntu ngokuthe ngqo ngaphandle kokuba ndisebenze nomguquleli okanye umlungisi, nto leyo ebumba indlela aphuma ngayo amabali,” utshilo.

eng: Syrian-Kurdish journalist Khabat Abbas, who has covered the war in Syria, attests to the importance of that.
xho: Intatheli yaseSyria-Kurdish uKhabat Abbas, obhale ngemfazwe yaseSyria, uyangqina ukubaluleka koko.

eng: Its knowing the language and the culture that gives people a sense of comfort to open up to you, she told VOA from Qamishli, Syria.
xho: Kukwazi ulwimi kunye nenkcubeko eyenza abantu bazive bekhululekile ukuba bathethe nawe, uxelele iVOA evela eQamishli, eSiriya.

eng: That knowledge helped when Abbas, 34, was on assignment with Sancha in March 2021. They traveled to a Kurdish-run detention camp in northeast Syria ,
xho: Olo lwazi lwanceda xa uAbbas, oneminyaka engama-34 ubudala, ngethuba esebenza ngaphandle noSancha ngoMatshi 2021. Baya kwinkampu yamaKurdish ababevalelwe kumntla-mpuma weSiriya,

eng: And interviewed female jihadists affiliated with IS, for a story in El Pais.
xho: Babe nodliwano-ndlebe nama-jihadists abhinqileyo anxulumene ne-IS, ngebali e-El Pais.

eng: While in Qamishli [in northeast Syria], I ran into two British journalists, very good colleagues of mine, who were disappointed after Shamima Begum and other women at the came refused to talk to them,
xho: “Ngethuba ndandiseQamishli [kumntla-mpuma weSyria], ndadibana neentatheli ezimbini zaseBritane, oogxa bam abalungileyo, ababedanile emva kukaShamima Begum nabanye namanye amanina enkampini ala ukuthetha nabo,

eng:
Sancha said, referring to a young woman who left her home in Britain aged 15 to join IS.	”utshilo uSancha, ebhekisa kumfazi oselula owashiya ikhaya lakhe eBritane eneminyaka eli-15 ukuya kujoyina i-IS.
Their fixer was a man, so the jihadist women didnt talk to them because they are radical, and they dont talk to men. But then I was able to sit with Shamima and other women, who gave fantastic interviews from inside their tents, Sancha said.	Umlungisi wabo wayeyindoda, ngoko ke abafazi be-jihadist abazange bathethe nabo ngenxa yokuba abathethi namadoda. Kodwa ke ndakwazi ukuhlala noShamima kunye nabanye abafazi, abanikela udliwano-ndlebe oluhle ngaphakathi kweentente zabo,  Watsho uSancha.
Abbas had a role in getting to talk to those women, she added.	U-Abbas wayenefuthe ekufumaneni ukuthetha nabo bafazi, wongeze watsho.
Unlike Sancha and Gebeily, Abbas grew up in the marginalized Kurdish region of Syria, where until the war began in 2011, journalism effectively didnt exist.	Ngokungafaniyo noSancha kunye noGebeily, u-Abbas wakhulela kwingingqi yaseKurdish yaseSyria, apho kwada kwaqala imfazwe ngo-2011, ubuntatheli babungekho.
Ordinary people in our region were used to seeing women pick up arms and fight, but they werent used to seeing a woman hold a camera on the streets and on front lines, Abbas said.	“Abantu abaqhelekileyo kwingingqi yethu bebeqhele ukubona abantu basetyhini bethatha izixhobo kwaye besilwa, kodwa bebengaqhelanga ukubona umntu obhinqileyo ebambe ikhamera ezitratweni  nangaphambili,” utshilo u-Abbas.
It took a lot of sacrificing for me to convince my family and society that Im as good, if not better, as my male colleagues.	Kwathatha ukuzincama okukhulu ukuze ndiqinisekise usapho lwam kunye noluntu ukuba ndilungile, ukuba andingcono, njengabalingane bam abangamadoda.
Journalism appealed to her because the story of the Middle East has often been told by male journalists, both local and foreign.	Ubuntatheli bamtsala umdla kuba ibali loMbindi Mpuma belisoloko libaliswa ziintatheli ezingamadoda, alapha ekhaya nakwamanye amazwe.
The narrative hasnt changed because of that, but if local and international women journalists get a real chance to tell the story of the Middle East, 	Ibali alitshintshanga ngenxa yoko, kodwa ukuba iintatheli zasekhaya kunye nezamazwe ngamazwe zabasetyhini bafumana ithuba lokwenyani lokubalisa ibali loMbindi Mpuma, 
that narrative could change, which would affect the way others see this region, Abbas said.
xho: ibali lingatshintsha, elinokuthi lichaphazele indlela abanye abawubona ngayo lo mmandla,”utshilo uAbbas.

eng: Sancha also believes women in journalism have an impact on the way issues are viewed in the region, including post-traumatic stress disorder and the effect it has on female health, and subjects such as violence and alcohol.
xho: U-Sancha naye ukholelwa ukuba abafazi kwi-journalism banempembelelo kwindlela imiba ejongwa ngayo kwingingqi, kubandakanywa uxinzelelo emva kokuphazamiseka kunye nomphumo onalo kwimpilo yabasetyhini, kunye nezifundo ezifana nobundlobongela kunye notywala.

eng: We talk about all these issues that men normally would not speak about, she said.
xho: “Sithetha ngayo yonke le miba amadoda ebengafuni kuthetha ngayo,” utshilo.

xho: Umphathi wabalindi base-Iran uthi i-Israel izenzela iimeko zokuzitshabalalisa

xho: Izenzo ze-Israel zidala iimeko zokuzitshabalalisa, umphathi we Revolutionary Guards wase-Iran ngoLwesihlanu uxelele indibano yeJerusalem Day apho kwaboniswa khona imijukujelwa ye-Kheibar Buster eyenziwe ekhaya.

eng: State television said millions of Iranians joined rallies marking Quds Day, the Arabic name for Jerusalem, in state-organized marches across the country.
xho: Umabonwakude welizwe uthe izigidi zabantu base-Irani bazibandakanya kwiindibano zokuphawula iQuds Day, igama lesiArabhu leJerusalem, kwimingcelele eququzelelwe ngurhulumente kwilizwe liphela.

eng: It showed the Israeli flag being set on fire and groups of people around the country shouting choreographed "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.
xho: Ibonise iflegi yase-Israel itshiswa kwaye amaqela abantu kwilizwe lonke bekhwaza "Ukufa eMelika, Ukufa ku-Israel" izilogeni.

eng: Supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said in a televised speech that anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians rejected compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.
xho: Inkokeli ephakamileyo u-Ayatollah Ali Khamenei uthe kwintetho kamabonakude ukuba uqhanqalazo oluchasene ne-Israeli kunye nohlaselo lubonise ukuba abantu basePalestine bayala ukuthotyelwa ngabasemagunyeni baseArabhu kunye noSirayeli.

eng: Opposition to Israel is a touchstone of belief for Iran, which backs Palestinian and Lebanese Islamist militant groups opposed to peace with Israel, which Tehran does not recognize.
xho: Ukuchaswa kwe-Israel ngumlinganiselo wokukholelwa kwi-Iran, exhasa amaqela e-Palestine kunye neLibanon yamaSilamsi achasene noxolo kunye ne-Israel, uTehran angawaniki ngqwalaselo.

eng: What has happened in Palestine in recent years annuls all plans for compromise with the Zionist enemy (Israel) because no plan for Palestine can be implemented in the absence or contrary to the opinions of its owners, the Palestinians, Khamenei said, speaking in Arabic and addressing Palestinians and other Arabs.
xho: Into eyenzekileyo ePalestine kule minyaka idlulileyo itshitshisa zonke izicwangciso zokulalanisa notshaba lwaseZionist (Israeli) kuba akukho sicwangciso sePalestine esinokuthi siphunyezwe xa ingekho okanye ngokuchaseneyo nezimvo zabanini bayo, amaPalestine, utshilo uKhamenei. IsiArabhu kunye nokuthetha nabantu basePalestina kunye namanye ama-Arabhu.

eng: Thus, Khamenei said, all previous peace agreements -- such as the 1993 Oslo Accords, the two-state solution to resolve the Israeli-Palestinian conflict,
xho: Ngoko, uKhamenei uthe, zonke izivumelwano zoxolo zangaphambili-ezinje nge-1993 Oslo Accords, isisombululo samazwe amabini ukusombulula impixano yase-Israel-Palestina,

eng: And former U.S. President Donald Trump's plan dubbed the Deal of the Century "are null and void".
xho: Kwaye isicwangciso sowayesakuba nguMongameli waseMelika uDonald Trump esibizwa ngokuba yiDeal of the Century "ayinamsebenzi kwaye asinto".

eng: President Ebrahim Raisi, Irans military commanders and senior officials also attended the rallies in which people were allowed to march through the streets, the first time since the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic two years ago.
xho: Umongameli u-Ebrahim Raisi, abalawuli basemkhosini base-Iran kunye namagosa aphezulu baye bazimasa iindibano apho abantu babevunyelwa ukuba baqhankqalaze ezitratweni, okokuqala okoko kwaqhambuka isifo esihlasele uzwelonke i-coronavirus kwiminyaka emibini edlulileyo.

eng: Iran's Jerusalem Day rallies are held annually in support of Palestinians, who want East Jerusalem as the capital of a future state in territories captured by
xho: Imikhosi yase-Iran yeJerusalem Day ibanjwa minyaka le ukuxhasa abantu basePalestina, abafuna i-East Jerusalem ibe likomkhulu lelizwe elizayo kwiindawo ezithinjiweyo.

eng: Israel in a 1967 war, on the last Friday of the Muslim fasting month of Ramadan.
xho: I-Israel kwimfazwe ka-1967, ngoLwesihlanu wokugqibela wenyanga yokuzila ukutya yamaSilamsi yeRamadan.

eng: Stop your vicious deeds.
xho: Yekani izenzo zenu ezikhohlakeleyo.

eng: You know well that we are people of action and reaction," Revolutionary Guards commander Hossein Salami, addressing Israel, told demonstrators in Tehran.
xho: Uyaya kakuhle ukuba singabantu abasebenzayo kunye abasabelayo,”umphathi wabaGadi beNguquko u-Hossein Salami, ethetha no-Israyeli, uxelele abaqhankqalazi eTehran.

eng: Our responses are painful.
xho: “Iimpendulo zethu zibuhlungu.

eng: You create conditions for your own destruction.
xho: Udala iimeko zokutshabalalisa.

eng: We will not leave you alone ...
xho: Asizokushiya wedwa...

eng: You know better than me what will befall you if you take evil action."
xho: Wazi ngcono kunam okuya kukwehlela xa uthe wathatha isenzo esibi.

eng: Iran's military has vowed to retaliate harshly against any attack by Israel, which has often voiced concern over the Iranian nuclear program.
xho: Umkhosi wase-Iran wenze isibhambathiso sokuziphindezela kabukhali kulo naluphi na uhlaselo lwe-Israel, esoloko ivakalisa inkxalabo ngenkqubo yenyukliya yase-Iran.

eng: Tehran says the program is for peaceful purposes only.
xho: UTehran uthi le nkqubo yeyeenjongo zoxolo kuphela.

eng: Israel, whose existence the Islamic Republic does not recognize, has long threatened military action against Iran if talks between Tehran and world powers fail to curb Iranian nuclear activity. Iran says its nuclear ambitions are peaceful.
xho: I-Israel, ubukho bayo i-Islamic Republic engabuboniyo, kudala isoyikisa ngenyathelo lomkhosi ngokuchasene ne-Iran ukuba iingxoxo phakathi kweTehran kunye namagunya ehlabathi ziyasilela ukunqanda umsebenzi wenyukliya waseIran. I-Iran ithi amabhongo ayo enyukliya aseluxolweni.

eng: In February, the Islamic Republic unveiled its "Kheibar Buster" missile with a range of 1,450 km (900 miles).
xho: NgoFebruwari, i-Islamic Republic yatyhila umjukujelwa wayo othi "Kheibar Buster"  olunoluhlu lweekhilomitha ezili-1,450 (iimayile ezingama-900).

eng: Iran, which has one of the biggest missile programs in the Middle East, says its ballistic missiles have a range of up to 2,000 km (1,200 miles) and are capable of reaching its arch-foe Israel and U.S. bases in the region.
xho: I-Iran, eneyona nkqubo inkulu yemijukujelwa kuMbindi Mpuma, ithi imijukujelwa yayo ye-ballistic inoluhlu oluya kuthi ga kwi-2,000 yeekhilomitha (1,200 imayile) kwaye iyakwazi ukufikelela kutshaba lwayo olukhulu u-Israyeli kunye neziseko zase-US kulo mmandla.

eng: Kheibar refers to an ancient Jewish oasis in the Arabian Peninsula's Hijaz region that was overrun by Muslim warriors in the 7th century.
xho: I-Kheibar ibhekisela kwindawo yamandulo yamaYuda yase-Arabia kwi-Hijaz ingingqi ye-Hijaz eyathi yahlaselwa ngamajoni amaSilamsi ngenkulungwane ye-7.

eng: Tehran regards its ballistic missile program as an important deterrent against the United States, Israel and other adversaries, and has rejected Western demands to halt it.
xho: I-Tehran ithatha inkqubo yemijukujelwa njengesithintelo esibalulekileyo ngokuchasene ne-United States, i-Israel kunye nezinye iintshaba, kwaye izalile iimfuno zaseNtshona zokuyimisa.

eng: Over the past year, Iran and the United States have engaged in fitful, indirect talks in Vienna to revive a 2015 nuclear deal that then-President Donald Trump reneged on in 2018 and that Iran, in turn, began violating in 2019.
xho: Kunyaka ophelileyo, i-Iran kunye ne-United States ziye zabandakanyeka kwiingxoxo ezifanelekileyo, ezingathanga ngqo eVienna zokuvuselela isivumelwano senyukliya sonyaka ka-2015 awathi ngoko uMongameli uDonald Trump wasirhoxisa ngo-2018 kwaye i-Iran, nayo, yaqala ukowophula ngo-2019.

eng: Under the 2015 deal, Iran agreed to limit its nuclear program in return for relief from economic sanctions.
xho: Ngaphantsi kwesivumelwano sika-2015, i-Iran yavuma ukunciphisa inkqubo yayo yenyukliya ukuze ifumane isiqabu kwizohlwayo zezoqoqosho.

eng: While they appeared close to resurrecting the deal in March, talks stalled over last-minute Russian demands and whether Washington might drop Iran's Revolutionary Guards from its Foreign Terrorist Organization list.
xho: Ngelixa babonakala besondele ekuvuseni isivumelwano ngo-Matshi, iingxoxo zamisa kwiimfuno zaseRussia zomzuzu wokugqibela kunye nokuba iWashington inokulahla iRevolutionary Guards yase-Iran kuluhlu lwayo loMbutho wabanqolobi bangaphandle.

eng: As Fewer Americans Attend Church, Can Coffee Shops Fill the Void?
xho: Njengoko bambalwa abantu baseMelika abaya eCaweni, ingaba iivenkile zekofu zinako ukuzalisa ililize?

eng: Churches and other houses of worship have historically played critical social and political functions in American society.
xho: Iicawe kunye nezinye izindlu zonqulo ngokwembali bezidlala indima ebalulekileyo yezentlalo nezopolitiko kuluntu lwaseMelika.

eng: But fewer people are attending religious services, and the decline of churches and other houses of worship threatens to leave a void that could potentially be filled by coffee shops.
xho: Kodwa bambalwa abantu abaya kwiinkonzo zonqulo, kwaye ukuwohloka kweecawe kunye nezinye izindlu zonqulo kusongela ukushiya indawo enokuthi ivalwe ziivenkile zekofu.

eng: For so much of American history, the church has really been — or their congregations have really been — essential, providing an unheralded role in providing cohesion and connectedness in communities … encouraging civic engagement and political participation, says Daniel Cox, director of the Survey Center on American Life and a senior fellow at the American Enterprise Institute.
xho: Kwimbali enkulu yaseMelika, icawe ibiyeyona nto ibalulekileyo - okanye amabandla abo ebebalulekile, ebonelela ngendima engachazwanga ekuboneleleni ngentsebenziswano kunye nokunxibelelana eluntwini ... Iziko loPhando kuBomi baseMelika kunye nomntu ophezulu kwiZiko loShishino laseMelika.

eng: It was not happenstance or luck that the civil rights movement emerged out of the church, Cox says.
xho: “Ayizange ibe sisenzeko nje okanye ithamsanqa ukuba umbutho wamalungelo abantu uphume ecaweni,” utshilo uCox.

eng: And you see that cross-culturally … whether it's in predominantly white rural communities, in the suburbs, wherever, churches have historically been really, really important.
xho: Kwaye uyayibona loo nto ngokwenkcubeko ... nokuba kukwiindawo ezihlala abantu abamhlophe ubukhulu becala, kwiindawo ezisemaphandleni, naphi na apho, iicawe bezikade zibalulekile ngokwembali.

eng: Churches and other houses of worship have also played a role in helping immigrants assimilate once they arrive in America, Cox says.
xho: Iinkonzo kunye nezinye izindlu zonqulo nazo ziye zadlala indima ekuncedeni abantu abavela kwamanye amazwe ukuba bafane bakuba befikile eMelika, utshilo uCox.

eng: In 1999, 70% of Americans said they belonged to a church, mosque or synagogue.
xho: Ngo-1999, i-70% yabantu baseMelika bathi bangamalungu enkonzo, i-mosque okanye indlu yesikhungu.

eng: By 2020, that number had dropped to 47%.
xho: Ngo-2020, elo nani lehle laya kutsho kuma-47%.

eng: A 2019 survey found that only about three in 10 Americans say they attend weekly religious services.
xho: Uvavanyo luka-2019 lufumanise ukuba bathathu kwabalishumi abantu baseMelika abathi baya kwiinkonzo zeveki ngeveki.

eng: Third places  Lack of involvement and affiliation with churches, mosques and synagogues means people might be missing out on what urban sociologist Ray
xho: Iindawo zesithathu Ukunqongophala kokubandakanyeka kunye nokuzibandakanya neecawe, iimosque kunye nezindlu zesikhungu kuthetha ukuba abantu banokuphoswa yintoni isazi ngentlalo yoluntu uRay.

eng: Oldenburg dubbed as "third places" — public gathering spots that offer something that home, the "first place," and work, the "second place," might not.
xho: U-Oldenburg ezibizwa ngokuba  "ziindawo zesithathu" - iindawo zokuhlanganisana zikawonke-wonke ezibonelela ngento ethile ekhaya, "indawo yokuqala," kunye nomsebenzi, "indawo yesibini," azingenako zona.

eng: Oldenburg argued that third places are critical to a communitys social vitality.
xho: U-Oldenburg waxoxa ukuba iindawo zesithathu zibalulekile kubomi boluntu ekuhlaleni.

eng: An October 2021 survey conducted by the American Survey Center found that commercial spaces like coffee houses foster trust and connection in American communities and could help fill the void left by churches.
xho: Uphando luka-Okthobha ku-2021 olwenziwa yiAmerican Survey Center lufumanise ukuba iindawo zorhwebo njengezindlu zekofu zikhuthaza ukuthembana kunye noqhagamshelo kuluntu lwaseMelika kwaye inokunceda ukuvala isithuba esishiywe ziinkonzo.

eng: If you're a regular at a cafe, the barista may know what you usually order, and they can make it for you, and that feels good, says clinical psychologist Dr.
xho: Ukuba uqhelekile kwindawo yokusela ikofu, umenzi kofu unokuyazi into oqhele ukuyi-odola, kwaye bakwenzele yona, kwaye oko kuvakala kulungile, utsholo ugqirha wolwazi ngengqondo.

eng: Maria Espinola, an assistant professor in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Neuroscience at the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine.
xho: UMaria Espinola, unjingalwazi oncedisayo kwiDepartment of Psychiatry and Behavioural Neuroscience kwiYunivesithi yaseCincinnati College of Medicine.

eng: It feels good to be recognized, to know that people are expecting you, to know that people care about you, to know that you belong, because the need for belonging and human connection is a fundamental need that we all have, and it's important to have that fulfilled in different ways, Espinola says.
xho: Kuvakala kumnandi ukuqatshelwa, ukwazi ukuba abantu bakulindele, ukwazi ukuba abantu bakukhathalele, ukwazi ukuba unendawo, kuba imfuno yokuba nendawo kunye nokunxibelelana kwabantu sisidingo esisisiseko esinayo sonke, kwaye kubalulekile. ukuba oko kuzalisekiswe ngeendlela ezahlukeneyo,”utshilo uEspinola.

eng: So, places like third places can allow us to do that.
xho: Ke, iindawo ezinjengeendawo zesithathu zinokusivumela ukuba senze loo nto.

eng: In the past, churches and other houses of worship have been a third place for many Americans.
xho: Ngaphambili, iinkonzo nezinye izindlu zonqulo beziyindawo yesithathu kubantu abaninzi baseMerika.

eng: In 2019, 67% of people surveyed said they have a third place
xho: Ngo-2019, iipesenti ezingama-67 zabantu abaphononongwayo bathi banendawo yesithathu

eng: a coffee shop, bar, restaurant, park or other places in their community that they visit regularly.
xho: ivenkile yekofu, indawo yokusela, indawo yokutya, ipaki okanye ezinye iindawo kwiindawo abahlala kuzo abazindwendwela rhoqo.

eng: That number dropped to 56% in 2021 — a number that could have been affected by the COVID-19 pandemic.
xho: Elo nani lehle laya kutsho kwi-56% ngo-2021 - inani elinokuchatshazelwa sisifo sikazwelonke i-COVID-19.

eng: What we found was that people who had a third place were much more connected to their community, says Cox.
xho: “Into esiyifumeneyo kukuba abantu ababenendawo yesithathu banxibelelene kakhulu noluntu lwabo,” utshilo uCox.

eng: They're much more likely to engage in other activities there.
xho: “Babonakala besenza ezinye izinto apho.

eng: They are much more trusting of their neighbors. There's a whole great array of positive social outcomes that were connected to having a third place … and for a lot of Americans, it's a coffee shop or a cafe."
xho: Bakholose ngakumbi ngabamelwane babo. Kukho uluhlu olukhulu lweziphumo ezilungileyo zentlalo ezidityaniswe nokuba nendawo yesithathu ... kwaye kubantu abaninzi baseMelika, yivenkile yekofu okanye ikhefi. "

eng: What coffee shops have in their favor is that they can be found almost everywhere, all over the country,
xho: Into iivenkile zekofu ezinayo ezizisebenzelayo kukuba zifumaneka phantse kuyo yonke indawo, kulo lonke ilizwe,

eng: And anyone who wants to can stop by regularly.
xho: Kwaye nabani na ofuna ukuya angaya rhoqo.

eng: And many are open most days of the week.
xho: Kwaye ezininzi zivuliwe iintsuku ezininzi zeveki.

eng: Cox says even brief coffee shop encounters can increase a sense of belonging.
xho: U-Cox uthi kwa iindibano ezimfutshane kwivenkile yekofu zinokunyusa imvakalelo yokuba izive unendawo.

eng: I think there's a lot of potential here, and a lot of it is unrealized potential, Cox says.
xho: “Ndicinga ukuba zininzi izinto ezinokwenzeka apha, kwaye uninzi lwazo lunezinto ezingekafezekiswa,” utshilo uCox.

eng: But in terms of what they could do, there's a lot there.
xho: Kodwa malunga nento abanokuyenza, kuninzi apho.

eng: I've been in places where the same group of folks come in there to play chess.
xho: Ndikhe ndakwiindawo apho iqela elifanayo labantu liza kudlala ichess.

eng: Or they have their informal bunch of retirees. …
xho: Okanye baneqela labo elingekho sikweni labadlali abathathe umhlala-phantsi. …

eng: They just got together, and they talked and chatted and caught up with each other. …
xho: Badibana nje, bancokola bancokola baxelelana ngobomi babo. …

eng: I don't know where else they would have gone — maybe a church, but maybe not — to share information, to encourage each other to maybe get involved in an activity.
xho: Andazi ukuba bebengaya ngaphi na—mhlawumbi ecaweni, kodwa mhlawumbi hayi—ukwabelana ngolwazi, ukukhuthazana ukuba mhlawumbi babandakanyeke kumsebenzi othile.

eng: And I think that is what is so powerful about coffee shops."
xho: Kwaye ndicinga ukuba le yeyona nto inamandla malunga neevenkile zekofu. "

eng: Are COVID-19 Restrictions Stunting Children’s Immune Systems?
xho: Ingaba izithintelo ze-COVID-19 ziyawoyisa amajoni omzimba abantwana?

eng: Some medical experts have expressed concern that COVID-19 preventative measures, like masking and remote schooling, are potentially weakening childrens immune systems by shielding them from the usual childhood illnesses.
xho: Ezinye iingcali zonyango zivakalise inkxalabo yokuba amanyathelo othintelo lwe-COVID-19, njengokugquma imaski kunye nokufundela emakhaya, anokuthi enze buthathaka amajoni omzimba wabantwana ngokubakhusela kwizigulo eziqhelekileyo zobuntwana.

eng: There are a lot of reasons to believe that kids need to be exposed to things to keep their immunity complex, so that should they encounter something very dangerous, they have aspects of their immunity that might cross over and help protect them against those things, says Sara Sawyer, a professor of molecular, cellular and developmental biology at the University of Colorado Boulder.
xho: Zininzi izizathu zokukholelwa ukuba abantwana kufuneka bavezwe kwizinto zokugcina amajoni emizimba yabo enamandla, ukuze ukuba bathe badibana nento eyingozi kakhulu, banamanye amajoni omzimba okunokuthi awele kwaye ancede abakhusele kwezo zinto. Utsho uSara Sawyer, unjingalwazi webhayoloji yemolekyuli, yeselula kunye nophuhliso kwiYunivesithi yaseColorado Boulder.

eng: At birth, vulnerable infants get antibodies from their mothers breast milk, which helps protect them until they can build their own immunity.
xho: Ekuzalweni, iintsana ezisesichengeni zifumana izilwa-buhlungu ezisuka kunina kubisi lwebele, oluzinceda luzikhusele de zibe nokwakha owazo amajoni omzimba.

eng: Its no accident that babies start putting things in their mouths as soon as they gain enough dexterity to pick things up.
xho: Akuyongozi ukuba iintsana ziqalise ukubeka izinto emilonyeni yazo ngokukhawuleza nje ukuba zizuze ubugcisa obaneleyo bokuthatha izinto.

eng: They're doing that because they're sampling the environment and building their immunity.
xho: “Bayenza loo nto ngenxa yokuba bavavanya imekobume kwaye bakha amajoni omzimba.

eng: That's an evolutionary trait," Sawyer says.
xho: Luphawu lokutshintsha kwezinto,” utshilo uSawyer.

eng: Theyre exposing their body to germs in a certain, level way to build their immunity.
xho: “Baveza imizimba yabo kwiintsholongwane ngendlela ethile, ekumgangatho wokwakha amajoni emizimba yabo.

eng: So, some people would argue that childhood illnesses, like colds and stomach bugs, build our immunity so that when more dangerous things come along, we're prepared and we don't get as sick from those more dangerous things."
xho: Ngoko ke, abanye abantu banokuthi izigulo zobuntwana, ezinjengokubanda kunye nesisu, zakha amajoni omzimba ukuze xa kuvela izinto eziyingozi ngakumbi, sizilungiselele kwaye singaguli ngenxa yezo zinto ziyingozi."

eng: Even before the pandemic, epidemiological evidence suggested that children in more developed countries, where handwashing and the use of sanitizer are more prevalent, might have less-developed immune systems compared to kids in developing nations who are routinely exposed to more bacteria, viruses and allergens.
xho: Ngaphambi kwesifo sikazwelonke, ubungqina be-epidemiology bacebisa ukuba abantwana abakumazwe aphuhlileyo, apho ukuhlanjwa kwezandla kunye nokusetyenziswa kwesicoci sezifo kuxhaphake kakhulu, banokuba namajoni omzimba angaphuhlisiyo xa kuthelekiswa nabantwana abakumazwe asakhasayo abasoloko bedibana neebhaktheriya ezininzi, iintsholongwane kunye nezinto ezinokuthi zenzeke.

eng: This makes kids in more industrialized countries more vulnerable to developing autoimmune diseases, according to whats known as the "hygiene hypothesis."
xho: Oku kwenza abantwana kumazwe ahambela phambili kwezoqoqosho babe sesichengeni sokuphuhlisa izifo ezizimelayo, ezaziwa ngokuba yi "hygiene hypothesis."

eng: The hygiene hypothesis is actually quite controversial because it's thought that our exposure to microbes isn't the only factor, says Cody Warren, a virologist and immunologist who is a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Colorado Boulder.

eng: A lot of this could also be dictated by genetics, diet, and the environment that we live in.
xho: “Uninzi lwale nto lunokuchazwa lufuzo, ukutya, kunye nendawo esihlala kuyo.

eng: There are other things that go into that equation."
xho: Kukho ezinye izinto ezingena kulo mba."

xho: Omnye wabo, uJustine Masika Bihamba, uxelele indibano yaseWashington, D.C., abafundi baseyunivesithi nabemi abaxhalabileyo ukuba

eng: Rostagno explained that foreign non-governmental organizations get funding to tackle the issue of sexual violence, but local organizations often get ignored.

eng: The problem is that the money in most cases is spent to pay for the fixed cost of the organization, for the salaries of expat people coming to the region and to the country, while the local non-governmental organizations, those working with the communities, with the women, with the children, in the villages, those who need need money to survive in order to do their work do not have access," said Rostagno.

xho: Ukwamemelele inkundla yamazwe ngamazwe ukuba iCongo incede ukuphelisa ukungohlwaywa ngokubanzi, kunye nenkundla zamatyala zasekuhlaleni zamaxhoba odlwengulo ukuba afune ubulungisa.

eng: In North Kivu, where more than 5 million people are estimated to live, she said there are only three tribunals.
xho: EMantla eKivu, apho abantu abangaphezu kwezigidi ezi-5 baqikelelwa ukuba bahlala khona, uthe kukho iinkundla ezintathu kuphela.

eng: Desmond Tutu Retires From Public Life.
xho: UDesmond Tutu Uthatha umhlala-phantsi kuBomi boLuntu.

eng: Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and was critical of the war in Iraq.
xho: U-Desmond Tutu walwa ucalucalulo eMzantsi Afrika, kwaye wayegxeka imfazwe yase-Iraq.

eng: We waged a war that shouldn't have happened, he said.He also spoke out against genocide in Rwanda.
xho: “Silwe imfazwe ebekungamelanga yenzeka,” utshilo.Ukwathethe ngokubulawa kwabantu eRwanda.

eng: We waged a war that shouldn't have happened, he said.He also spoke out against genocide in Rwanda.
xho: “Silwe imfazwe ebekungamelanga yenzeka,” utshilo.Ukwathethe ngokubulawa kwabantu eRwanda.

eng: God have mercy on us, he said.The retired Anglican archbishop announced in July that he would retire from public life on his birthday.
xho: “UThixo abe nenceba kuthi,” utshilo. Ubhishophu omkhulu waseTshetshi osele esidla umhlala-phantsi ubhengeze ukuba uzakurhoxa kubomi boluntu ngomhla wakhe wokuzalwa.

eng: The time has come to slow down, and sip maybe rooibos tea with my beloved wife in the afternoons he said.
xho: “Lifikile ixesha lokuba sithobe isantya, ndisele mhlawumbi iti yerooibos nomfazi wam endimthandayo emva kwemini,” utshilo.

eng: Tutu rose through the ranks of the Anglican church in South Africa to become the first black Anglican archbishop of Capetown.
xho: UTutu wenyuka kwinkonzo yamaTshetshi eMzantsi Afrika waba ngu-archbishophu wokuqala omnyama waseTshetshi eKapa.

eng: He was a vocal critic of South Africa's white-ruled government and encouraged non-violence to end apartheid.
xho: Wayengumgxeka kakhulu urhulumente woMzantsi Afrika owawulawulwa ngabamhlophe kwaye wayekhuthaza ukungaphathwa ngobundlobongela ukuze kupheliswe ucalucalulo.

eng: Tutu was the recipient of many awards, and in 1984, he received a Nobel Peace Prize for advocating "a democratic and just society without racial divisions.
xho: UTutu nguye owafumana iimbasa ezininzi, kwaye ngo-1984, wafumana iwonga leNobel Peace Prize ngokumela "uluntu lwedemokhrasi nolunobulungisa ngaphandle kocalucalulo ngokobuhlanga.

eng: He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa.
xho: “Wasebenzisa olu lwazi ukuqinisa iphulo lokuchasa ucalu-calulo, ememelela ukuba kugxothwe uMzantsi Afrika kwezoqoqosho.

eng: After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it an incredible day when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race elections.
xho: Emva kokuphela kocalucalulo, uTutu wayibiza ngokuba yimini engakholelekiyo xa uNelson Mandela ephumelele unyulo lokuqala lweentlanga zonke eMzantsi Afrika.

eng: I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world, he said.
xho: “Ndingathi eyona nto iphezulu kum kuxa ndandimi ebhalkhoni ngo-1994 ndisazisa umongameli wethu omtsha kraca eMzantsi Afrika nehlabathi,” utshilo.

eng: To help mend the nation, President Mandela appointed Tutu as head of the country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission.
xho: Ukunceda isizwe, uMongameli Mandela wonyula uTutu njengentloko yeKomishoni yeNyaniso noXolelwaniso yelizwe.

eng: The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.
xho: Eli qela likhuphe ingxelo equka izivumo ezininzi zetyala phantsi kocalucalulo ukuze kuxolelwe.

eng: It makes specific proposals on how we can cultivate a culture of human rights and of structures to insure that the atrocities of the past will not reoccur, Tutu said.
xho: “Yenza izindululo ezithe ngqo malunga nokuba singayihlakulela njani inkcubeko yamalungelo oluntu kunye neziseko zokuqinisekisa ukuba izenzo zenkohlakalo zangaphambili azizukwenzeka kwakhona,” utshilo uTutu.

eng: Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.
xho: UTutu ukwakhankasele ukulwa intlupheko kunye nogawulayo.

eng: In recent years, he expressed his disappointment in post-apartheid South Africa, especially the level of violent crime.
xho: Kwiminyaka yakutshanje, uvakalise ukuphoxeka kwakhe kuMzantsi Afrika wasemva kocalucalulo, ingakumbi izinga lolwaphulo-mthetho olunobundlobongela.

eng: Despite his withdrawal from public life, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.
xho: Ngaphandle kokurhoxa kubomi boluntu, uTutu uthi uzakuqhubeka nokuxhasa isiseko sakhe soxolo kwaye uzakuhlala eyinxalenye yeqela labadala baseburhulumenteni abakhankasela uxolo kunye namalungelo oluntu.

eng: But Tutu says he will no longer give interviews and, as he put it, will mostly "shut up."
xho: Kodwa uTutu uthi akasayi kuphinda enze udliwano-ndlebe kwaye, njengoko eyibeka, "uvale umlomo."

eng: I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed, he said.
xho: “Ndibe yinxalenye yomzabalazo wethu wenkululeko nedemokhrasi, kwaye ndiyinxalenye yombhiyozo wokuba siye saphumelela,” utshilo.

eng: I have been part of the post apartheid dispensation and long for us to do infinitely better.
xho: “Ndibe yinxalenye yolawulo localucalulo kwaye ndilangazelela ukuba senze ngcono kakhulu.

eng: Many say his voice will be missed.
xho: Abaninzi bathi ilizwi lakhe liza kukhunjulwa.

eng: Malawi's Jacaranda School for Orphans Celebrates Christmas.
xho: Isikolo saseMalawi seJacaranda seNkedama siBhiyozela iKrisimesi.

eng: The management for the Jacaranda School for Orphans in Malawis commercial capital Blantyre recently hosted a party for its students as it closed for Christmas and New Years Day holidays.
xho: Abaphathi besikolo seNkedama iJacaranda kwikomkhulu lezorhwebo eMalawi iBlantyre kutshanje yenze itheko labafundi baso njengoko besivalile ngeeholide zeKrisimesi noSuku loNyaka oMtsha.

eng: Around 500 people including students, staff members and others from surrounding areas attended the event, which was held at the schools premises in Chigumula area.
xho: Bamalunga namakhulu amahlanu abantu abaquka abafundi, abasebenzi nabanye abasuka kwiindawo ezingqongileyo bebezimase lo msitho ububanjelwe kumasango ezikolo kwingingqi yaseChigumula.

eng: The party included gifts, Santa Claus, and a "dancing show case" by the students.
xho: Itheko laliquka izipho, uSanta Claus, kunye "netyala lomboniso womdaniso" ngabafundi.

eng: The school management told VOA that the yearly celebration has been a school tradition for the past 13years.
xho: Abaphathi besikolo baxelele iVOA ukuba lo mbhiyozo waminyaka le ube sisithethe sesikolo kule minyaka ili-13 idlulileyo.

eng: The school's director, Luc Deschamps, said: "[We feel] it is very important for us to celebrate Christmas because the children do not have parents.
xho: Umphathi wesikolo uLuc Deschamps wathi: “[Sivakalelwa kukuba] kubaluleke kakhulu ukuba siyibhiyozele iKrismesi kuba abantwana abanabazali.

eng: They stay with either a grandmother or a distant aunt or uncle, and they are not able to cerebrate at home or have a party or a little bit of sweets and cake for the children.
xho: Bahlala nomakhulu okanye umakazi okanye umalume okude, kwaye abakwazi ukwenza imibhiyozo ekhaya okanye ukwenza itheko okanye intwana yeelekese nekeyiki yabantwana.

eng: So, we provide a happy day for the children to celebrate the spirit of Christmas.
xho: Ke, sinika usuku olonwabileyo lokuba abantwana babhiyozele umoya weKrisimesi.

eng: And it is also a way of our children to learn to give."
xho: Kwaye ikwayindlela yabantwana bethu yokufunda ukupha."

eng: No media source currently available.
xho: Akukho mthombo weendaba ukhoyo ngoku.

eng: Deschamps, who is also an Honorary Consul of France in Malawi, said before the main event the patrons were treated to "a nice meal" from the students.
xho: UDeschamps, okwanguMmeli oHloniphekileyo waseFrance eMalawi, uthe phambi komsitho ophambili abaxhasi baphathelwe "isidlo esimnandi" esivela kubafundi.

eng: We had a big, big lunch with good meat and rice,[the dish made from maize flour called] nsima, of course, and vegetables.
xho: Saba nesidlo esikhulu sasemini kunye nenyama emnandi nerayisi, [isitya esenziwe ngomgubo wombona esibizwa] yinsima, kanye nemifuno.

eng: And it was the students themselves who cooked the meal for everybody, for over 500 people," he said.
xho: Kwaye yayingabafundi ngokwabo ababephekela wonke umntu isidlo, abantu abangaphezu kwama-500, ”utshilo.

eng: One of the students, Eddah Zimba, said, "The celebrations are really cool, ...
xho: Omnye wabafundi uEddah Zimba uthe, “Imnandi kakhulu imibhiyozo,...

eng: I have enjoyed myself.
xho: Ndiye ndazonwabela.

eng: I have eaten, and now I am here dancing.
xho: Ndityile, ngoku ndilapha ndiyadanisa.

eng: What has interested me most is the gift that we have received the like the puffs, the biscuits, the squash and the dance."
xho: Eyona nto indenze ndanomdla kakhulu sisipho esisifumeneyo ezifana neepuffs, iibhiskithi, umngqusho kunye nomdaniso.

eng: She thanked the schools management for hosting the Christmas party for students who in most cases do not have such celebrations at home.
xho: Ubulele abaphathi bezikolo ngokwenza itheko leKrisimesi labafundi abathi kwiimeko ezininzi bangabi nayo imibhiyozo elolu hlobo emakhaya.

eng: Another student Emmanuel Chisale said good meal aside, the event has taught him the spirit of sharing.
xho: Omnye umfundi u-Emmanuel Chisale uthe ukutya okumnandi ecaleni, lo msitho umfundise umoya wokwabelana.

eng: This party has brought a change in my life.
xho: “Eli qela lizise utshintsho ebomini bam.

eng: I have learned that we have to have a heart for sharing one another as the Father Christmas was doing, he said.
xho: Ndifunde ukuba kufuneka sibenentliziyo yokwabelana njengokuba iFather Christmas yayisenza,” utshilo.

eng: Founded in 2002, the Jacaranda School for Orphans is the only one in Malawi which provides free primary, secondary and tertiary education to children without parents.
xho: Yasekwa ngo-2002, iJacaranda School for Orphans seso sodwa eMalawi esibonelela ngemfundo yasimahla kubantwana abangenabazali.

eng: A Malawian woman, Marie Da Silva, started the school after she returned from the United States where she spent nineteen years working as a nanny.
xho: Inkosikazi yaseMalawi, uMarie Da Silva, waqala esi sikolo emva kokuba ebuyile eMelika apho wachitha iminyaka elishumi elinesithoba esebenza njengonozala.

eng: Economists Predict Bumpy Road for Malawi's Economy in 2015.
xho: Iingcali zezoQoqosho zibona amagingxingxi kwindlela eya phambili kuQoqosho lwaseMalawi ngo-2015.

eng: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate.
xho: Iingcali zoqoqosho eMalawi zithi eli lizwe kusenokwenzeka ukuba liqhubeleke lijongene nemingeni yemali ngo-2015 ngaphandle kokuba urhulumente angaphinda athembeke kubaxhasi, abasabambe umyinge wamashumi amane eepesenti ekhulwini wenkxaso yohlahlo lwabiwo-mali ngenxa yorhwaphilizo olwaziwa njengeCashgate.

eng: More than $30 million were looted from government coffers in the scandal, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.
xho: Imali engaphezu kwezigidi ezingama-30 zeerandi yaphangwa kwingxowa-mali karhulumente kulo manyala, yaye abantu abaliqela, kuquka namagosa karhulumente, babanjwa.

eng: The withholding of donor aid has forced Malawi's government to pass what is known as the Zero Aid national budget for the
xho: Ukubanjwa koncedo lwabaxhasi kuye kwanyanzela urhulumente waseMalawi ukuba aphumeze oko kwaziwa ngokuba yiZero Aid budget yesizwe.

eng: 2014-2015 fiscal year. Analysts, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics lecturer at the Polytechnic College of the University
xho: Unyaka-mali ka-2014-2015. Abahlalutyi, abafana noAbel Mwanyungwe, umhlohli wezoqoqosho kwiKholeji yasePolytechnic yeYunivesithi.

eng: of Malawi, say the drop in spending has hurt the economy.
xho: waseMalawi, bathi ukuhla kwenkcitho konakalisa uqoqosho.

eng: This has been a bumpy year as we are coming from the Cashgate effects that have quite a major dent on the economys performance.
xho: “Lo ibingunyaka wamagingxigingxi njengoko siphuma kwiziphumo zeCashgate ezithe kratya kuqoqosho lweli.

eng: We have seen that in most cases the very delicate and crucial departments and service providers have been affected, in the sense that we dont have enough drugs in the hospitals.
xho: Sibonile ukuba kwiimeko ezininzi amasebe abuthathaka nabalulekileyo kunye nabanikezeli beenkonzo baye bachaphazeleka, ngendlela yokuba asinawo amayeza aneleyo ezibhedlele.

eng: In schools, in terms of teachers payments is not in time," said Mwanyungwe.
xho: Ezikolweni, intlawulo yootitshala ayifiki ngexesha,” utshilo uMwanyungwe.

eng: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
xho: UMwanyungwe ukwayamanise iCashgate nokuhla kwexabiso lemali yaseMalawi, kwacha, okubangele uqhankqalazo lwabasebenzi abohlukeneyo bakarhulumente befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo.

eng: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
xho: Umzekelo, abasebenzi abanika inkxaso kwiinkundla bezikwisithuba seeveki ezintandathu begwayimba, befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo ngeepesenti ezingamashumi amane anesihlanu ekhulwini nto leyo urhulumente athi akanako ukuyifikelela kuba akanamali.

eng: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.
xho: Abasebenzi beAnti-Corruption Bureau eMalawi baye bagwayimba befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo ngamashumi asixhenxe ekhulwini de urhulumente wabagrogrisa ngelithi baza kuphulukana nemivuzo yabo kaDisemba ukuba ababuyi.

eng: Mwanyungwe said the government can only avoid further strikes in 2015 if it makes efforts to restore donor confidence in the management of its public finances.
xho: UMwanyungwe uthe urhulumente angalunqanda olunye uqhankqalazo ngo-2015 ukuba wenza iinzame zokubuyisela intembeko yabaxhasi kulawulo lwemali karhulumente.

eng: My fear is that if we dont have this donor confidence and donor support coming back to the economy,
xho: “Uloyiko lwam kukuba, ukuba asinalo ukuzithemba kwabaxhasi kunye nenkxaso yabaxhasi ibuyela kuqoqosho,

eng: We may force the government to go into serious local borrowing that would lead to serious repercussions in terms of inflation, in terms of interest rates and this may have a sort of catch-catch lose situation, said Mwanyungwe.
xho: Singanyazela urhulumente ukuba angene kwimboleko-mali yasekhaya enokuthi ikhokelele kwiziphumo ezibi malunga nokunyuka kwamaxabiso, ngokwenzala yemali-mboleko kwaye oku kunokuba nemeko yokuphulukana nokubanjiswa,” utshilo uMwanyungwe.

eng: The donors are, among other things, demanding that the government prosecute all those involved in the scandal and strengthen its financial management system.
xho: Abaxhasi, phakathi kwezinye izinto, bafuna urhulumente atshutshise bonke abo babandakanyekayo kulo mbhodamo kwaye omeleze inkqubo yolawulo lwemali.

eng: Newton Kambala, the president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the scandal rendered
xho: UNewton Kambala, umongameli weMalawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, uthe ihlazo elenziwe.

eng: 2014 as "a very bad year for the business sector, because of huge debts that the government owes the private sector."
xho: U-2014 "njengonyaka ombi kakhulu kwicandelo loshishino, ngenxa yamatyala amakhulu urhulumente awatyala icandelo labucala."

eng: He warned that if the situation persists, "2015 will be worse."
xho: Walumkisa ukuba, ukuba imeko iyaqhubeka, "u-2015 uya kuba mbi."

eng: In his state of the nation address last Saturday, Malawi president Peter Mutharika said his government is doing everything possible to address the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.
xho: Kwintetho yakhe yobume besizwe ngoMgqibelo odlulileyo, umongameli waseMalawi uPeter Mutharika uthe urhulumente wakhe wenza konke okusemandleni ukulungisa iingxaki ezibangelwe lihlazo leCashgate.

eng: My government has strengthened the financial system to make sure that Cashgate never occurs again in Malawi.
xho: “Urhulumente wam uqinise inkqubo yezemali ukuqinisekisa ukuba iCashgate ayiphindi yenzeke eMalawi.

eng: We have resourced fairly well the law enforcement institutions, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, so that they do a thorough independent job, prosecute all suspects, and recover the stolen resources where possible," said Mutharika.
xho: Siwasebenzise kakuhle amaziko ogcino-mthetho aquka iAnti-Corruption Bureau ukuze enze umsebenzi ozimeleyo ngokucokisekileyo, atshutshise bonke abarhanelwa, abuyise nezixhobo ezibiweyo apho kunokwenzeka,” utshilo uMutharika.

eng: Mutharika also said his government is implementing newly-adopted fiscal reforms that seek to grow the countrys economy by 5.5 percent in 2014, up from an estimated 5.0 percent in 2013.
xho: UMutharika ukwathe urhulumente wakhe uphumeza inguqu entsha yezemali efuna ukukhulisa uqoqosho lwelizwe nge-5.5 pesenti ngo-2014, isuka kumyinge we-5.0 yeepesenti ngo-2013.

eng: Malawi to Conduct Door-to-Door HIV Testing
xho: IMalawi izakwenza uVavanyo lwe-HIV kwindlu ngendlu

eng: Malawians have mixed reactions to government plans to introduce door-to door HIV testing early next year.
xho: Abantu baseMalawi banezimvo ezahlukileyo kwizicwangciso zikarhulumente zokuqalisa ngovavanyo lwe-HIV kwindlu ngendlu ekuqaleni konyaka ozayo.

eng: Supporters say the step is urgently needed because 100 Malawians get infected each day, and an average of 138 die from AIDS daily.
xho: Abaxhasi bathi eli nyathelo lifuneka ngokungxamisekileyo kuba abantu baseMalawi abali-100 bayasulelwa suku ngalunye, yaye umlinganiselo we-138 ubulawa nguGawulayo mihla le.

eng: Minister of Health Jean Kalirani announced the plans during the recent commemoration of World AIDS Day in the northern district of Karonga.
xho: UMphathiswa wezeMpilo uJean Kalirani ubhengeze ezi zicwangciso ngethuba kutsha nje isikhumbuzo soSuku lweHlabathi lwe-AIDS kwisithili esisemantla eKaronga.

eng: We will go in the villages asking for blood samples to check whether that person is HIV positive or not.
xho: “Sizakungena ezilalini sicela ukuba sithathelwe igazi ukuze kujongwe ukuba loo mntu akanayo na okanye akanayo na.

eng: And those that will be found HIV positive will definitely be given the care they need.
xho: Kwaye abo baya kufunyanwa bene-HIV ngokuqinisekileyo baya kunikwa ukhathalelo abaludingayo.

eng: And those who are found negative will also be counseled so that they remain negative," said Kalirani.
xho: Nabo bafunyenwe bengenayo nabo bazolulekwa ukuze bahlale bengenayo,” utshilo uKalirani.

eng: Kalirani said the campaign will start in mid-March and will aim to reach everyone in the country, including people who are
xho: UKalirani uthe eli phulo lizakuqala phakathi kuMatshi kwaye liza kujolisa ukufikelela kumntu wonke kweli lizwe kuquka nabantu abakhoyo

eng: far from health facilities that provide HIV testing and counseling services.
xho: kude nezibonelelo zempilo ezibonelela ngeenkonzo zokuvavanyelwa i-HIV kunye neengcebiso.

eng: She said the campaign is in line with the goal of ending HIV infection by 2030.
xho: Uthe eli phulo lihambelana nenjongo yokuphelisa usulelo lwe-HIV ngo-2030.

eng: Malawi's HIV infection rate is currently at 10 percent, a slight drop from three years ago.
xho: Umlinganiselo wosulelo lweHIV eMalawi ngoku ukwi-10 ekhulwini, ukwehla kancinci xa kuthelekiswa neminyaka emithathu eyadlulayo.

eng: The announcement has raised fears in some Malawians, such as Steven Jailosi, a primary school teacher in rural Blantyre, who feel the campaign will likely infringe upon peoples privacy.
xho: Esi sibhengezo sinyuse uloyiko kwabanye abantu baseMalawi, abanjengoSteven Jailosi, utitshala wesikolo samabanga aphantsi eBlantyre, ocinga ukuba eli phulo lingaphazamisa ubumfihlo babantu.

eng: I think it is not okay because they will be invading our privacy.
xho: “Ndicinga ukuba akulunganga kuba baza kuphazamisa ubumfihlo bethu.

eng: HIV testing is supposed to be private.
xho: Uvavanyo lwe-HIV kufuneka lube lolwabucala.

eng: No one is supposed to know that I went for an HIV testing unless I make a choice to tell them," said Jailosi.
xho: Akukho mntu ekumele ukuba azi ukuba ndiye kuvavanyo lwe-HIV ngaphandle kokuba ndenza ukhetho lokumxelela,” utshilo uJailosi.

eng: Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that although she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.
xho: U-Ester Makonokaya, unobhala eBlantyre, uthe nangona sele evavanyiwe, uvakalelwa kukuba ukuvavanyelwa intsholongwane kaGawulayo kwindlu ngendlu kuzokophula iimfihlo zabantu.

eng: Government should instead take the mobile clinics to the villages where people will be able to access them on their own rather than taking testing in their homes, because that might mean that some of the people who are not supposed to know other peoples status will know because, you know, when someone has been tested you show some reactions, said Makonokaya.
xho: “Urhulumente makathathe ezi kliniki zihambayo azise ezilalini apho abantu bazokwazi ukufikelela kuzo bodwa kunokuba baye kuvavanyo emakhayeni abo, kuba loo nto ingathetha ukuba abanye abantu ekungafanelanga ukuba bazazi iimeko zabanye abantu. kuba uyazi ukuba xa umntu evavanyiwe ubonakalisa ukusabela,” utshilo uMakonokaya.

eng: Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and a producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."
xho: UMacpherson Maulana, intatheli yaseBlantyre nokwangumvelisi weenkqubo zikanomathotholo ngezempilo, uxelele iVOA ukuba urhulumente uzokwenza ngcono ukufundisa abantu baseMalawi ngesidingo sokuvavanyelwa intsholongwane kagawulayo ukuze abantu baziyele ngokwabo uvavanyo ngaphandle kokutyhalwa.

eng: I fear it could end up into fights.
xho: “Ndiyoyika ukuba ingaphelela ekulweni.

eng: You see it happened in Liberia recently where people who were coming to help people suspected to have contracted Ebola were even killed.
xho: Uyabona kwenzekile eLiberia mva nje apho abantu ababeze kunceda abantu ekurhaneleka ukuba bosulelwe yi-Ebola bade babulawa.

eng: So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily," said Maulana.
xho: Ngoko ke, imfundo yezoluntu yeyona nto ibalulekileyo ukuze abantu bakhuthazwe ukuba baphume baye kuvavanywa ngokuzithandela,” utshilo uMaulana.

eng: However, HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, whose NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.
xho: Nangona kunjalo, umcebisi weHIV/AIDS, uDavid Odali, nophethe umbutho i-Umunthu Foundation eqhuba iiprojekthi ezinxulumene ne-HIV, ugxininise ukuba iimfihlo ziza kukhuselwa.

eng: Confidentiality will be upheld. Lets consider the household setup.
xho: Imfihlo iya kugcinwa. Makhe siqwalasele ukusekwa kwekhaya.

eng: I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to members of that family.
xho: Ndicinga ukuba into yokuqala iya kuba kukubonelela ngengcebiso yeqela kumalungu olo sapho.

eng: [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclosing the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately," said Odali.
xho: [Ewe] abantu banokuvavanywa ngelixa abanye bejonge, kodwa xa kuthethwa ngeziphumo, umcebisi kufuneka aveze ezo ziphumo kumntu ngamnye ngokwahlukeneyo,” utshilo u-Odali.

eng: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.
xho: UOdali uthe izakuba kuye umntu ovavanyiweyo ukuba aveze ubume bakhe.

eng: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people.
xho: Ngo-2006, i-charity Development Aid from People to People yenza uvavanyo lwe-HIV kwindlu ngendlu kwisithili saseThyolo naseBlantyre, lwafikelela kuma-400,000 abantu.

eng: The organization says it worked well.
xho: Lo mbutho uthi usebenze kakuhle.

eng: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi.
xho: Ingxaki yamanzi Iphakamisa uloyiko lwezifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi eMalawi.

eng: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water.
xho: Abantu baseMalawi abakwikomkhulu lezorhwebo lelizwe, iBlantyre, bakholisa ukuxhomekeka kumanzi aphuma empompeni.

eng: But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.
xho: Kodwa kwezi nyanga zintlanu zidlulileyo, iitepu bezisoloko zomile, nto leyo enyanzelise abahlali ukuba bakhe amanzi kwimithombo engakhuselekanga efana nemilambo namaqula, logama kusetyenzwa kwisikhululo sokumpompa amanzi edolophini.

eng: The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
xho: Umngcipheko wokufumana izifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi uyakhula.

eng: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.
xho: EBlantyre neziphaluka, abahlali bachithe iintsuku ezintlanu bengenawo amanzi aphuma etephini.

eng: Women, who by Malawi tradition are responsible for household tasks, complain of the risks they face when fetching water from rivers far from residential areas.
xho: Abasetyhini, abathi ngokwesiko laseMalawi banoxanduva lokwenza imisebenzi yasekhaya, bakhalaza ngeengozi abahlangabezana nazo xa besiya kukha amanzi emilanjeni ekude neendawo zokuhlala.

eng: Rhoda Milanzi, a housewife and mother of three, tells VOA the journeys through bushy footpaths are risky.
xho: URhoda Milanzi, umama wekhaya kunye nomama wabantwana abathathu, uxelele iVOA ukuba uhambo oluhamba kwiindledlana zeenyawo lunobungozi..

eng: We wake up every day 2 a.m., sometimes 1 a.m., to go and collect water.
xho: “Sivuka yonke imihla ngentsimbi yesi-2 kusasa, ngamanye amaxesha ngo-1 ekuseni, siye kukha amanzi.

eng: There are so many risks.
xho: Kukho imingcipheko emininzi.

eng: You see, sometimes we would meet witches, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."
xho: Uyabona maxa wambi sasidibana namagqwirha, iinyoka endleleni,” utsho, “neengcuka zazisileqa.

eng: Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river.
xho: UMlanzi uthi ukuthomalalisa umthwalo wokuthwala amanzi okuhlamba ekhaya, abafazi bakhetha ukuhlamba emlanjeni.

eng: But she says they have been disturbed by youths who hide in the nearby bush.
xho: Kodwa uthi baye baphazanyiswa lulutsha oluzifihle kumatyholo akufutshane.

eng: These youths of today would come there and hide somewhere to see us naked.
xho: “Olu lutsha lwanamhlanje luza kufika apho luzifihle ndaweni ithile ukuze lusibone sihamba ze.

eng: This has been a major embarrassment. In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
xho: Oku kuye kwaba lihlazo elikhulu. Ngenene sakhalaza kwiinkosi ngalo nto.

eng: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath," she explains.
xho: Abanye babo bohlwaya, kodwa uyazi ukuba ngamanye amaxesha bebekhwela emithini ukuze bajonge abafazi abadala njengathi xa sihlamba,” ucacise watsho.

eng: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
xho: Ingxaki yamanzi ikwachaphazele ukuhanjiswa kweenkonzo zempilo.

eng: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
xho: Kwiiveki ezintathu ezidlulileyo, abasemagunyeni kwisibhedlele iQueen Elizabeth Central eBlantyre baqinisekise ukuba baye banqumamisa ukwenza utyando ngenxa yokunqaba kwamanzi.

eng: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
xho: Abakhankasi bamalungelo ezempilo balumkisa ngokuqhambuka kwezifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi, ngakumbi kwiindawo ezixineneyo, ukuba le meko ishiywe ingasonjululwanga.

eng: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.
xho: Amagosa eBlantyre Water Board abalela ingxaki ikakhulu kwiprojekthi eqhubekayo exhaswa ngemali yi-European Union efuna ukufakela oomatshini bokumpompa abatsha kwi-Walkers Ferry, isikhululo sokumpompa esikhulu.

eng: Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
xho: UPriscilla Mateyu, osisithethi sebhodi yamanzi eBlantyre, uthi le projekthi kulindeleke ukuba inyuse umthamo wokuvelisa amanzi ukuya kutsho kwi-105,000 cubic metres ngosuku ukusuka kwimveliso ekhoyo ngoku eyi-78,000 cubic metres ngosuku.

eng: January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015].
xho: NgoJanuwari kuxa iprojekthi iphela. Kodwa ukuze oomatshini abatsha nayo yonke enye into iqale ukusebenza kakuhle, kufuneka silinde kude kube nguMatshi [2015].

eng: That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be," Mateyu said.
xho: Kulapho silindele ukuba amanqanaba anyuke kwaye nomthamo wemveliso uphucuke ubeyilento silindele ukuba ibe yiyo,” utshilo uMateyu.

eng: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.
xho: Iqumrhu elijongene namalungelo abathengi basekuhlaleni, iConsumers Association of Malawi, bebeceba ukubamba imilindelo kwibhodi yamanzi de kube yinto eqhelekileyo ukuhanjiswa kwamanzi, kodwa ibhodi yacela abaqhankqalazi ukuba bayeke, bethembisa ukuhambisa amanzi kubahlali ngokusebenzisa iitanki zamanzi ezihambayo.

eng: The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
xho: Iqela lamalungelo abathengi linike ibhodi yamanzi iiveki ezimbini ukuba ifezekise isibophelelo sayo phambi kokuba iqhube noqhanqalazo.

eng: Malawi President Under Fire for Giving Money to Journalists
xho: Umongameli waseMalawi uphantsi komlilo ngokunika imali kwiintatheli

eng: Malawi President Peter Mutharika is under fire for giving envelopes containing $125 to more than 80 media people at a dinner he hosted last month in Blantyre.
xho: Umongameli waseMalawi uPeter Mutharika utyholwa ngokunika imvulophu equlethe i-125 yeedola kubantu beendaba abangaphezu kwe-80 kwisidlo ebesibambe kwinyanga ephelileyo eBlantyre.

eng: The editor of the privately owned Times Television said reporters were told the envelopes contained the presidents plans for the media - which has been critical of the governments economic performance.
xho: Umhleli weTimes Television yabucala uthe abacholacholi baxelelwa ukuba iimvulophu zinezicwangciso zoomongameli kumajelo eendaba - nto leyo ibigxeka ukusebenza kukarhulumente kwezoqoqosho.

eng: In his column published in Malawis Sunday Times newspaper, editor Grecian Tukula said he was not sure why the money was given to journalists at the state dinner.
xho: Kwikholamu yakhe epapashwe kwiphephandaba laseMalawi iSunday Times, umhleli uGrecian Tukula uthe akaqinisekanga ngesizathu sokuba le mali inikwe iintatheli kwisidlo sikarhulumente.

eng: Tukula said he initially decided to return the money but reversed the decision to avoid "creating a scene."
xho: UTukula uthi uqale wathatha isigqibo sokuyibuyisela le mali kodwa wasirhoxisa eso sigqibo ukuze aphephe “ukuzijongisa.”

eng: But the editor for the Weekend Nation newspaper, George Kasakula, told VOA that he returned the money right away.
xho: Kodwa umhleli wephephandaba iWeekend Nation, uGeorge Kasakula, uxelele iVOA ukuba uyibuyise kwangoko le mali.

eng: I just felt it was not right for me to receive the money, so I returned it.
xho: “Ndavakalelwa kukuba ayifanelekanga ukuba ndiyifumane loo mali, ngoko ndayibuyisela.

eng: My understanding is that if someone invites me to a workshop, its their duty to ensure that they feed me, they accommodate me and they transport me.
xho: Ukuqonda kwam kukuba xa umntu endimema kwiworkshop, yindima yabo ukuqinisekisa ukuba uyandondla, uyandihlalisa kwaye uyandithutha.

eng: But in this case, I didnt see why I should get that allowance because I didnt spend anything to go to Sanjika [Palace]," said Kasakula.
xho: Kodwa kule meko, andizange ndibone ukuba kutheni ndifanele ndifumane eso sibonelelo kuba andizange ndachitha nto ukuya eSanjika,” utshilo uKasakula.

eng: The issue has attracted more public attention after privately owned Capital Radio aired a story questioning the meaning of the cash handouts from the president.
xho: Lo mba utsale umdla woluntu emva kokuba inkampani yabucala yeCapital Radio yasasaza ibali elibuza ngentsingiselo yemali evela kumongameli.

eng: As Capital FM we serve the interest of the public.
xho: “SiyiCapital FM sisebenzela uluntu.

eng: This issue has been all over the social media, and even we as a media are implicated [we believe] it is paramount that we follow up and get to the bottom of the matter," said Steven Dakalira, the head of news and current affairs at Capital Radio.
xho: Lo mcimbi ubugcwele kumakhasi onxibelelwano, kwaye nathi njengamajelo eendaba siyachaphazeleka “sikholelwa ukuba kubaluleke kakhulu ukuba siwulandele kwaye sifikelele ezantsi kulo mba,” utshilo uSteven Dakalira, intloko yeendaba nemicimbi yangoku. kwiCapital Radio.

eng: In his column in the Nyasa Times, Malawi professor of law Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa said what President Mutharika did by giving money handouts to journalists at a news event was tantamount to bribery. He has called on Mutharika to resign or face impeachment proceedings.
xho: Kwikholamu yakhe kwiNyasa Times, unjingalwazi wezomthetho eMalawi uDanwood Mzikenge Chirwa uthe into eyenziwa nguMongameli Mutharika ngokunika iintatheli imali kumsitho weendaba kufana nokunyoba. Ucele uMutharika ukuba arhoxe okanye ajongane nenkqubo yokubeka ityala.

eng: Local civil society groups said that "by attempting to bribe the journalists" Mutharika subjected his leadership style to disrepute.
xho: Amaqela oluntu asekuhlaleni athi “ngokuzama ukunyoba iintatheli” uMutharika wadelela isidima sakhe sobunkokeli.

eng: Meanwhile, some journalists are donating the money to charity.
xho: Ngeli xesha, ezinye iintatheli zinikela ngemali kumbutho wesisa.

eng: Brian Ligomeka, the Managing Editor for the Times Group, told Times Television that all four employees there have donated the money to an orphanage.
xho: UBrian Ligomeka, uMhleli oLawulayo weTimes Group, uxelele iTimes Television ukuba bobane abasebenzi abalapho banikele ngemali kwikhaya leenkedama.

eng: At first we decided to return the money to the president but we later thought it wise to buy assorted items like sugar, salt, notebooks and donate it to needy children, said Ligomeka.
xho: “Siqale sathatha isigqibo sokuba siyibuyisele kumongameli le mali kodwa sabona bubulumko ukuba sithenge izinto ezahlukahlukeneyo ezifana neswekile, ityuwa, iincwadi zokubhalela sanikezela kubantwana abasweleyo,” utshilo uLigomeka.

eng: In his latest Sunday Times column, Raphael Tenthani, who also writes for BBC, apologized on behalf of other journalists "for letting down the public that trust journalists unreservedly."
xho: Kwikholamu yakhe yamva nje yeSunday Times, uRaphael Tenthani, okwabhalela iBBC, ucele uxolo egameni lezinye iintatheli “ngokuphoxa uluntu ukuba luthembe iintatheli ngokungagodli.

eng: Tenthani has since donated the money for charity work and said that although the journalists could have done better if they returned the money right away, doing so would have been perceived as disrespect to the head of state.
xho: UTenthani ukhuphe le mali yemisebenzi yesisa esithi nangona iintatheli bezinokwenza ngcono ukuba bezinokubuyisela le mali ngoko nangoko, ukwenza njalo bekuya kubonwa njengokungahloniphi intloko yelizwe.

eng: Maclan Kanyangwa, who heads the Department of Journalism and Media Studies at the Polytechnic College of the University of
xho: UMaclan Kanyangwa, okhokela iSebe lezobuntatheli kunye nezifundo zosasazo kwiKholeji yasePolytechnic kwiYunivesithi yase

eng: Malawi, said a media code of ethics bars journalists from accepting payment on a story.
xho: IMalawi, ithe ikhowudi yezokuziphatha yeendaba ithintela iintatheli ukuba zamkele intlawulo ngebali.

eng: Obviously the meeting at the palace was the newsworthy event.
xho: “Ngokucacileyo indibano eyayisebhotwe yayisisiganeko esibalulekileyo seendaba.

eng: There was a possibility that something was going to be published.
xho: Kwakunokwenzeka ukuba kukho into eyayiza kupapashwa.

eng: And in the event that this payment would have influenced journalist decision [on news judgment], then that becomes a problem," said Kanyangwa.
xho: Kwaye kwimeko apho le ntlawulo inokuba nefuthe kwisigqibo sentatheli [kwisigwebo seendaba], loo nto iba yingxaki,” utshilo uKanyangwa.

eng: Kanyangwa said he feels many journalists failed to return the money immediately because they might have been out of their ethical senses when they got the money.
xho: UKanyangwa uthe uvakalelwa kukuba iintatheli ezininzi zisilele ukubuyisela le mali ngoko nangoko kuba kusenokwenzeka ukuba zazingekho ezingqondweni xa zazifumana le mali.

eng: Efforts to talk to Presidential Press Officer Fredrick Ndala were not successful.
xho: Iinzame zokuthetha neGosa likaMongameli weendaba uFredrick Ndala azikhange zibe yimpumelelo.

eng: But some government authorities say the payment was not a bribe but meant for a fuel refund to those who attended the night event.
xho: Kodwa abanye abaphathi bakarhulumente bathi le ntlawulo ibingesosinyobo kodwa yenzelwe ukubuyisela amafutha kwabo bebezimase umsitho wasebusuku.

eng: Report: Manufacturing Could Free Poorest Nations From Poverty.
xho: Ingxelo: Ukwenziwa kwezinto kunokukhulula izizwe ezihluphekileyo kubuhlwempu.

eng: A new United Nations report urges the poorest countries in the world to shift from low- to high-productivity activities to improve their economies.
xho: Ingxelo entsha yeZizwe eziManyeneyo ikhuthaza amazwe ahlwempuzekileyo emhlabeni ukuba atshintshe ukusuka kwizinto eziphantsi ukuya kwimveliso ephezulu ukuphucula uqoqosho lwawo.

eng: In its annual Least Developed Countries Report, UNCTAD — the U.N. Conference on Trade and Development — says these countries must structurally transform their economies to free themselves from the "poverty trap," which is stunting economic growth and development.
xho: KwiNgxelo yayo yaminyaka le yaMazwe angaPhuhliswanga kangako, i-UNCTAD — iNkomfa yeZizwe eziManyeneyo yoRhwebo noPhuhliso – ithi la mazwe kufuneka aguqule ngokwesakhiwo uqoqosho lwawo ukuze akhululeke “kumgibe wentlupheko,” nto leyo edodobalisa ukukhula koqoqosho nophuhliso.

eng: Of the 48 nations the U.N. considers "Least Developed Countries" (LDCs), only one, Laos, is on track to achieve all seven of the Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) by 2015.
xho: Kwiintlanga eziyi-48 i-U.N. iqwalasela "ILeast Developed Country’s" (LDCs), enye kuphela, iLaos, isendleleni yokufezekisa zosixhenxe iiMillennium Development Goals (MDG's) ngo-2015.

eng: Only four African countries — Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda and Uganda — are likely to meet a majority of these targets.
xho: Ngamazwe amane kuphela ase-Afrika - i-Ethiopia, iMalawi, iRwanda kunye ne-Uganda - anokuthi afikelele uninzi lwezi njongo.

eng: This assessment is particularly grim in light of the even greater challenges awaiting these countries in the coming years.
xho: Olu vavanyo lubi kakhulu ngenxa yemiceli mngeni emikhulu elindele la mazwe kwiminyaka ezayo.

eng: The MDGs set a goal for nations to halve their poverty levels by 2015.
xho: I-MDGs ibeke injongo yokuba izizwe zinciphise amanqanaba entlupheko ngesiqingatha ngo-2015.

eng: The so-called Sustainable Development Goals, which carry on from where the MDGs leave off, call for eradication of poverty by 2030.
xho: Izinto ezibizwa ngokuba yiSustainable Development Goals, eziqhubela phambili ukusuka apho i-MDGs ziyeke khona, ibiza ukupheliswa kwentlupheko ngo-2030.

eng: According to Taffere Tesfachew, an UNCTAD official who works with African nations, it would be nothing short of a miracle for the LDCs to pull this off.
xho: Ngokutsho kukaTaffere Tesfachew, igosa le-UNCTAD elisebenza nezizwe zase-Afrika, akuyi kuba yinto engummangaliso ukuba ii-LDC zikhuphe oku.

eng: In order for the least developed countries to achieve this miraculous performance, he says they will need to structurally change their economies.
xho: Ukuze awona mazwe angaphuhlanga aphumeze lo mmangaliso, uthi kuyakufuneka ukuba atshintshe ngokwesakhiwo uqoqosho lwawo.

eng: He tells VOA this means shifting labor from activities with low productivity, such as small-scale agriculture and services to more dynamic activities with higher productivity, such as manufacturing and high-value services.
xho: Uxelela iVOA oku kuthetha ukutshintshwa kwabasebenzi kwimisebenzi enemveliso ephantsi, efana nezolimo ezincinci kunye neenkonzo ukuya kwimisebenzi eguqukayo enemveliso ephezulu, efana nemveliso kunye neenkonzo zexabiso eliphezulu.

eng: Countries that have moved up are the ones that are creating opportunities for those that are leaving agriculture to engage in things where they add value, where they get training and as it happens, manufacturing tends to have that sort of feature,
xho: “Amazwe anyukileyo ngawo adala amathuba okuba abo bashiya ezolimo bazibandakanye kwizinto apho bongeza ixabiso, apho bafumana uqeqesho nanjengoko kusenzeka, imveliso ithanda ukuba nolo hlobo,

eng: that is why this call for manufacturing, he said.
xho: yiyo loo nto ikhwelo lokwenziwa kwemveliso,” utshilo.

eng: Countries that are using policies to shift and influence capital and labor to move into this activity sector tend to do better.
xho: Amazwe asebenzisa imigaqo-nkqubo yokutshintsha kunye nokuphembelela inkunzi kunye nabasebenzi ukuba bangene kweli candelo lomsebenzi bavame ukwenza ngcono.

eng: Tesfachew says these high-productivity sectors tend to pay higher wages and create a demand for goods.
xho: UTesfachew uthi la macandelo anemveliso ephezulu athambekele ekuhlawuleni imivuzo ephezulu kwaye enze imfuno yempahla.

eng: This, he says, encourages investment.
xho: Oku, uthi, kukhuthaza utyalo-mali.

eng: On the surface, it appears that the LDCs are not doing badly.
xho: Ngasentla, kubonakala ngathi ii-LDCs azenzi kakubi.

eng: UNCTAD economic data show growth in these poor countries between 2002 and 2008 exceeded the seven percent target set by the international community.
