eng: Charting the Future of China’s Infrastructure Projects in Africa After a Decade of Lending
xho: Uwenza isakhelo ngekamva leeprojekthi zeziseko zophuhliso zaseChina e-Afrika emva kweshumi leminyaka lokuboleka

eng: China is financing the construction of four coal-fired power plants in southern Africa, despite its climate pledge in September to quit supporting such infrastructure overseas.
xho: I-China ixhasa ngezezimali ulwakhiwo lwemizi-mveliso emine yokuphehla umbane ngamalahle kuMazantsi e-Afrika, nangona yayenze isibhambathiso sayo malunga nesimo sezulu ngoSeptemba sokuyeka ukuxhasa oluhlobo lwezeseko zophuhliso phesheya kolwandle.

eng: But the new facilities taking shape in South Africa and Zimbabwe are just a few of Beijings massive investments in airports, railway lines and other national infrastructure on the African continent.
xho: Kodwa amaziko amatsha aqala ukumila eMzantsi Afrika naseZimbabwe lutyalo-mali olukhulu lwaseBeijing kwizikhululo zeenqwelomoya, imizila kaloliwe kunye nezinye iziseko zelizwe kwilizwekazi lase-Afrika.

eng: Many countries have been eager for the investment, but mounting levels of debt over the past five years are raising doubts about the long-term prospects for more expensive infrastructure projects.
xho: Amazwe amaninzi ebelulangazelela utyalo-mali, kodwa ukunyuka kwenqanaba lamatyala kule minyaka mihlanu idlulileyo anyusa ukuthandabuza malunga nethemba lexesha elide leeprojekthi zeziseko ezingundoqo ezisexabisweni eliphezulu.

eng: China committed to lending African countries $153 billion from 2000-2019, but that pace of lending may be slowing down.
xho: I-China izibophelele ekubolekeni amazwe ase-Afrika i-153 yeebhiliyoni zeedola ukusuka ngo-2000-2019, kodwa isantya sokuboleka imali sinokucotha.

eng: Chinese loan commitments dropped by 30% in 2019 when compared with the previous year, according to the China-Africa Research Initiative at the Johns Hopkins University School of Advanced International Studies.
xho: Izibophelelo zemali-mboleko yaseTshayina zehle ngama-30% ngo-2019 xa kuthelekiswa nonyaka ophelileyo, ngokutsho kweNyathelo loPhando lwaseTshayina-Afrika kwiSikolo seYunivesithi yaseJohns Hopkins yeZifundo eziPhakamileyo zaMazwe ngaMazwe.

eng: The research looks at loan commitments which get "disbursed to borrowers as projects are implemented."
xho: Uphando lujonga izibophelelo zemali-mboleko ethi "ihlawulwe kubaboleki njengoko kuphunyezwa iiprojekthi."

eng: In Zambia for example, Chinese financiers committed $10.3 billion in loans from 2000-2010.Since 2000, Zambia has only repaid some $1.2 billion to Chinese lenders.
xho: Ngokomzekelo, eZambia, abaxhamli bezimali baseTshayina baboleka i-10.3 yeebhiliyoni zeerandi kwimali-mboleko ukususela ngowama-2000 ukuya ku-2010.

eng: Uganda now owes China $200 million for its only international airport, fanning fears that China could seize it.
xho: I-Uganda ngoku ityala i-China i-200 yezigidi zeedola kwisikhululo seenqwelomoya sayo kuphela, esoyikela ukuba i-China inokusithimba.

eng: Both countries have rejected speculation in African media outlets of a Chinese takeover.
xho: Omabini la mazwe ayikhabile intelekelelo kumajelo eendaba ase-Afrika malunga nokuthathwa kweTshayina.

eng: Loan repayment measures  Neighboring Kenya had received a $4.5 billion loan to build a railway from Nairobi to the port city of Mombasa, and China indicates it will redo the terms after a committee of the African countrys parliament found that operating losses and debt to Chinese banks were straining taxpayers.
xho: Amanyathelo okubuyisela imali-mboleko Ummelwane waseKenya ufumene imali-mboleko ye-4.5 yeebhiliyoni zeerandi zokwakha uloliwe osuka eNairobi usiya kwisixeko saseMombasa, kwaye iChina ibonisa ukuba iza kuphinda iphinde ilandele imigaqo emva kokuba ikomiti yepalamente yamazwe ase-Afrika ifumanise ukuba ilahleko yokusebenza kunye namatyala kwiibhanki zaseTshayina. ukucinezela abahlawuli berhafu.

eng: Some analysts have warned that opaque lending terms means China could eventually seize infrastructure should countries struggle to meet repayments
xho: Abanye abahlalutyi balumkisile ukuba imiqathango yokuboleka imali e-opaque ithetha ukuba i-China inokubamba iziseko zophuhliso ukuba amazwe ayasokola ukuhlawula.

eng: U.S. and British officials say, "debt traps," where countries cannot raise enough money to repay Chinas loans, are structured to give Beijing leverage over time.
xho: Amagosa aseMelika kunye neBhritane athi, "amatyala," apho amazwe angenako ukuqokelela imali eyaneleyo yokubuyisela imali mboleko yaseTshayina, acwangciselwe ukunika amandla iBeijing ngokuhamba kwexesha.

eng: Last month, the head of Britains Secret Intelligence Service, Richard Moore, in an interview with BBC Radio 4 said Beijing can acquire "significant ports which have the potential to become naval facilities etcetera."
xho: Kwinyanga ephelileyo, intloko yeBritish Secret Intelligence Service, uRichard Moore, kudliwano-ndlebe ne-BBC Radio 4 yathi iBeijing inokufumana "amachweba abalulekileyo anokuba ngamaziko omkhosi wamanzi njl njl."

eng: Sri Lanka earlier this year passed legislation that critics say will give China control over a key deep-water port that Beijing financed.
xho: I-Sri Lanka ekuqaleni kwalo nyaka ipasise umthetho abathi abagxeki baya kunika i-China ukulawula izibuko eliphambili lamanzi anzulu elixhaswe yiBeijing.

eng: But that has not happened so far in Africa, where Chinese diplomats reject seizures are a part of Beijings strategy.
xho: Kodwa oko akwenzekanga ukuza kuthi ga ngoku e-Afrika, apho oonozakuzaku baseTshayina besala ukubanjwa yinxalenye yeqhinga laseBeijing.

eng: Not a single project in Africa has ever been "confiscated" by China because of failing to pay Chinese loans.
xho: Akukho nanye iprojekthi e-Afrika eyake yahluthwa yi-China ngenxa yokusilela ukuhlawula imali-mboleko yaseChina

eng: On the contrary, China firmly supports and is willing to continue our efforts to improve Africa's capacity for home-driven development," stated the Chinese Embassy in Uganda.
xho: Ngokuchasene noko, i-China ixhasa ngokuqinileyo kwaye izimisele ukuqhubeka nemigudu yethu yokuphucula amandla e-Afrika kuphuhliso oluqhutywa ekhaya, "watsho uMzi wozakuzo waseChina eUganda.

eng: Instead of seizing assets, Beijing will likely extend deadlines for loan repayment or rework payback terms such as interest rates, analysts told VOA.
xho: Endaweni yokubamba i-asethi, iBeijing inokwandisa ixesha lokuhlawula imali-mboleko okanye imiqathango yokubuyisela kwakhona njengenzala, abahlalutyi baxelele iVOA.

eng: Those measures would avert takeovers of the infrastructure itself and in turn preserve Chinas reputation in Africa where trade and lending have bested its superpower rival in dollar terms.
xho: Loo manyathelo anokuthi athintele ukuthathwa kweziseko zophuhliso ngokwawo kwaye agcine isidima samaChina e-Afrika apho urhwebo kunye nokuboleka imali kuye kwagqwesa lowo unamandla amakhulu ngokweedola.

eng: China will probably "keep kicking the can down the road" until creditors find the means to settle the loans, Bulelani Jili, an African studies Ph.D. candidate at Harvard University, told VOA.
xho: I-China ngokuqinisekileyo iya "kuqhubeka ikhaba itoti ezantsi kwendlela" de ababolekisi bafumane iindlela zokuhlawula imali-mboleko, u-Bulelani Jili, ongumfundi wase-Afrika we-Ph.D. umviwa kwiYunivesithi yaseHarvard, uxelele iVOA.

eng: To confiscate any assets, including minerals, would "confirm peoples initial biases of China as a neocolonial actor," Jili said, and risk upsetting diplomatic ties with "some of the few friends that China has on the global stage."
xho: Ukuthimba nayiphi na impahla, kubandakanya nezimbiwa, "kuya kuqinisekisa ukuthambekela kwabantu baseChina njengomdlali we-neocolonial," utshilo uJili, kunye nomngcipheko wokuphazamisa ubudlelwane bezozakuzo "nabanye babahlobo abambalwa i-China enabo kwihlabathi."

eng: From the China side, its about getting access to new possible markets and expanding both economic activity — also the diplomatic relation," he said.
xho: Ukusuka kwicala laseChina, malunga nokufikelela kwiimarike ezintsha ezinokwenzeka kunye nokwandisa imisebenzi yoqoqosho - kunye nobudlelwane bozakuzo, utshilo.

eng: Chinese loan concerns
xho: Iinkxalabo zemali-mboleko yaseChina

eng: China encourages lending to Africa in search of high returns on investments and a global reputation as a supporter of poor countries, said Edward Miguel, Oxfam professor in Environmental Resource Economics at the University of California, Berkeley.
xho: I-China ikhuthaza ukuboleka imali kwi-Afrika ekufuneni imbuyekezo ephezulu kutyalo-mali kunye nodumo lwehlabathi jikelele njengomxhasi wamazwe ahluphekileyo, utshilo u-Edward Miguel, unjingalwazi we-Oxfam kwi-Environmental Resource Economics kwiYunivesithi yaseCalifornia, eBerkeley.

eng: It is trying to "equal the U.S." as a donor country, he said.
xho: Izama "ukulingana ne-U.S." njengelizwe elinikelayo, watsho.

eng: However, China differs from other international lenders and donors mainly for its relative lack of transparency that raises questions in Africa as well as in the West, Miguel believes.
xho: Nangona kunjalo, iTshayina yohlukile kwabanye ababolekisi bamazwe ngamazwe kunye nabaxhasi ikakhulu ngenxa yokungafihli nto okubangela imibuzo e-Afrika kunye naseNtshona, uMiguel ukholelwa ukuba.

eng: Unlike loans from western governments or international lending bodies like the World Bank, which require labor and environmental safeguards on financed projects, Chinas aid and loans to Africa have been described as "no strings attached," which has been attractive for many countries.
xho: Ngokungafaniyo nemali-mboleko evela koorhulumente basentshona okanye imibutho ebolekisa ngemali yamazwe ngamazwe njengeBhanki yeHlabathi, efuna ukukhuselwa kwabasebenzi kunye nokusingqongileyo kwiiprojekthi ezixhaswa ngemali, uncedo lwaseChina kunye neemali-mboleko e-Afrika ziye zachazwa ngokuthi "akukho ntambo ziqhotyoshelweyo," eziye zanomtsalane kumazwe amaninzi.

eng: But African nations, especially with economies slipping because of the impacts of COVID-19, face increasing trouble paying back loans, said Hannah Ryder, senior associate with the Africa Program at the U.S. think tank Center for Strategic and International Studies.
xho: Kodwa amazwe ase-Afrika, ngakumbi uqoqosho luluhle ngenxa yeempembelelo ze-COVID-19, ajongene nengxaki eyandayo yokuhlawula imali mboleko, utshilo uHannah Ryder, ugxa omkhulu kwiNkqubo yeAfrika kwiziko lokucinga lase-US leSifundo seQhinga kunye neHlabathi.

eng: China and other countries are becoming more sophisticated in bargaining with one another," wrote Deborah Brautigam of the School of Advanced International Studies at Johns Hopkins University and Harvard Business School's Meg Rithmire in a joint article.
xho: I-China kunye namanye amazwe aya ephucuka ngakumbi ekuxoxweni omnye nomnye, wabhala uDeborah Brautigam weSikolo se-Advanced International Studies kwiYunivesithi yaseJohns Hopkins kunye neHarvard Business School's Meg Rithmire kwinqaku elidibeneyo.

eng: Residents in Dakar, Senegal, where the 500-person Forum on China-Africa Cooperation meeting took place on November 29-30, want more Chinese-funded infrastructure but without debt levels like those of the 1990s, Ryder noted.
xho: Abahlali baseDakar, eSenegal, apho i-500-personment Forum ye-China-Africa Cooperation yenzeke ngoNovemba 29-30, bafuna iziseko ezingakumbi ezixhaswa ngemali yaseTshayina kodwa ngaphandle kwamanqanaba etyala njengalawo e-1990, uRyder waphawula.

eng: Chinese creditors are expected to lend less money to Africa going forward and more carefully analyze the projects those loans support, experts say. Loans have already "sobered down" [tapered off] from a peak in 2014, Jili said.
xho: Ababolekisi baseTshayina kulindeleke ukuba baboleke imali encinci e-Afrika ukuya phambili kwaye bahlalutye ngononophelo ngakumbi iiprojekthi ezixhasa inkxaso-mali, iingcali zithi. Iimali-mboleko sele "zithobile" [zicinywe] ukusuka kwincopho ngo-2014, utshilo uJili.

eng: Commitments for loans and other investments made at the China-Africa Cooperation meeting came to $40 billion, one-third less than the $60 billion made at the same conference in 2018.
xho: Izibophelelo ngemali-mboleko kunye nolunye utyalo-mali olwenziwe kwintlanganiso yeNtsebenziswano ye-China ne-Afrika lufike kwiibhiliyoni ezingama-40 zeerandi, isinye esithathwini esingaphantsi kweebhiliyoni ezingama-60 zeerandi ezenziwe kwinkomfa enye ngowama-2018.

eng: Lenders may calibrate loans based on predictions of a post-pandemic future when African countries have more cash, said Yun Sun, co-director of the East Asia program at the Stimson Center in Washington.
xho: Ababolekisi banokulinganisa imali mboleko ngokusekwe kuqikelelo lwekamva lobhubhane xa amazwe ase-Afrika enemali eninzi, utshilo uYun Sun, umlawuli wenkqubo yaseMpuma Asia kwiziko iStimson eWashington.

eng: Another option, she said, is to ensure Chinese equity from future projects as repayment for older loans, she said in a VOA interview.
xho: Enye inketho, uthe, kukuqinisekisa ukulingana kwamaTshayina kwiiprojekthi ezizayo njengembuyekezo yemali mboleko endala, utshilo kudliwanondlebe lweVOA.

eng: Its politically risky, because although its not an equity-asset swap, it smells a lot like some sort of swap, and [that] China is exploiting Africas weak position, so I dont think it will happen in the immediate future and in fact this debt restructuring is also taking quite a while," Sun said.
xho: Iyingozi kwezopolitiko, kuba nangona ingelulo utshintshiselwano lwe-asethi, inuka kakhulu njengokutshintshana, kwaye [ukuba] i-China ixhaphaza isikhundla esibuthathaka saseAfrika, ngoko andicingi ukuba kuya kwenzeka kwixesha elizayo kwaye enyanisweni. olu hlengahlengiso lwetyala luthatha ixesha,” utshilo uSun.

eng: China is becoming more confident all the while in setting up international public-private partnerships, though many African countries still worry about a repeat of the debt crisis in the 1980s and 1990s when nations could not pay off debt, Ryder says in an African Business commentary.
xho: I-China iya isiba nokuzithemba ngakumbi ngalo lonke eli xesha ekusekeni intsebenziswano phakathi kwamashishini abucala namazwe ngamazwe, nangona amazwe amaninzi ase-Afrika esaxhalabile malunga nokuphindaphinda ingxaki yamatyala ngeminyaka yoo-1980 noo-1990 xa amazwe ayengakwazi ukuhlawula amatyala, utshilo uRyder kwingxelo yoShishino lwase-Afrika. .

eng: International organizations ultimately wrote off that wave of unaffordable debt with conditions including opening "their economies to international trade, liberalize their currencies and drastically cut costs
xho: Imibutho yezizwe ngezizwe ekugqibeleni yalicima elatyala elingafikelelekiyo ngeemeko ezibandakanya ukuvula "uqoqosho lwabo kurhwebo lwamazwe ngamazwe, ukukhulula iimali zabo kunye nokunciphisa kakhulu iindleko.

eng: in exchange for loans," wrote Peter Fabricius in the Institute for Security Studies.
xho: ukutshintshiselana ngemali-mboleko,” wabhala uPeter Fabricius kwiZiko leZifundo zoKhuseleko.

eng: Fast forward to the present, with loans from China, African countries, Miguel said, often end up asking "what did we agree to do" and "how much do we owe" China.
xho: Ukukhawuleza ukuza ngoku, kunye nemali-mboleko evela e-China, amazwe ase-Afrika, uMiguel uthe, bahlala bebuza ukuba "sivumelene ukwenza ntoni" kwaye "sityala malini" e-China.

eng: Dutch Test for New Variant After Finding 61 COVID Cases Among South Africa Passengers
xho: IDutch yenza uvavanyo lohlobo olutsha lwesisifo emva kokufumana abantu abangama-61 abane-COVID phakathi kwabakhweli boMzantsi Afrika.

eng: Dutch health authorities said Saturday they had detected 61 COVID-19 cases among people who flew Friday from South Africa and were now doing further tests to see whether any are infected with the new omicron variant.
xho: Abasemagunyeni kwezempilo baseDutch bathi ngoMgqibelo bafumene abantu abayi-61 abanesifo se-COVID-19 phakathi kwabantu ababhabhe ngenqwelomoya ngolweSihlanu besuka eMzantsi Afrika kwaye ngoku besenza olunye uvavanyo ukubona ukuba ingaba bakho na abosulelwe luhlobo olutsha lwesifo i-omicron.

eng: The cases were discovered among around 600 passengers who arrived at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport on two flights Friday before the Dutch government halted air traffic from southern Africa due to concerns over the variant.
xho: Ezizigulane zifunyanwe phakathi kwabakhweli abamalunga nama-600 abafike kwisikhululo seenqwelomoya i-Amsterdam Schiphol ngeenqwelomoya ezimbini ngolweSihlanu phambi kokuba urhulumente waseDutch amise iinqwelo moya ezisuka emazantsi eAfrika ngenxa yenkxalabo malunga nohlobo olutsha lwesisifo.

eng: Dutch health authorities said Saturday they also would seek to contact travelers who had arrived from South Africa, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia and Zimbabwe since Monday and urge them to take a test as soon as possible.
xho: Abaphathi bezempilo baseDutch bathi ngoMgqibelo bazakufuna ukunxibelelana nabahambi abafike bevela eMzantsi Afrika, eBotswana, e-Eswatini, eLesotho, eMozambique, eNamibia kunye naseZimbabwe ukusukela ngoMvulo kwaye babakhuthaze ukuba bathathe uvavanyo ngokukhawulezileyo.

eng: The passengers from Friday's flights were kept separated from other travelers and those who tested positive are being kept in isolation at a hotel near the airport.
xho: Abakhweli abavela kwiinqwelomoya zangoLwesihlanu bagcinwe bohlukene nabanye abahambi kwaye abo bafunyaniswe benaso esisifo bagcinwe bodwa kwihotele ekufutshane nesikhululo seenqwelomoya.

eng: A spokesperson for the health ministry said it would not be known until later Saturday whether any of passengers are infected with the new variant.
xho: Isithethi senkonzo yezempilo sithe ayizukwaziwa de kube nguMgqibelo ukuba ingaba kukhona na abakhweli abosulelekileyo kolu hlobo lutsha lwesisifo.

eng: A spokesperson for KLM, the Dutch arm of Air France, said the airline was trying to determine what rules were in place as of Friday morning to prevent people with COVID-19 infections from boarding the flights, which departed from Cape Town and Johannesburg.
xho: Isithethi se-KLM, ingalo yaseDutch ye-Air France, ithe inkampani yeenqwelomoya ibizama ukufumanisa ukuba yeyiphi na imigaqo ekhoyo ukusukela ngentsasa yangoLwesihlanu ukuthintela abantu abosulelekileyo yi-COVID-19 ukuba bakhwele kwiinqwelomoya, ezisuka eKapa kunye naseRhawutini.

eng: Rules on the company's website said passengers had to present a negative COVID-19 "rapid antigen" test result taken 24 hours before departure but were not required to show proof of vaccination.
xho: Imithetho kwiwebhusayithi yenkampani yathi abakhweli kufuneka baveze iziphumo zovavanyo lwe-COVID-19  iziphumo "zerapid antigen" ethathwe kwiiyure ezingama-24 ngaphambi kokuhamba kodwa bekungafuneki ukuba babonise ubungqina bogonyo.

eng: Really Weird'  Paula Zimmerman, a Dutch photographer who returned from a family visit in South Africa on Friday morning, said the situation for the passengers on the planes was chaotic, as they were kept waiting on the tarmac and in the terminal for hours.
xho: Iyamangalisa ngokwenene' uPaula Zimmerman, umfoti waseDutch ubuye kutyelelo losapho lwakhe eMzantsi Afrika ngentsasa yangoLwesihlanu, uthe imeko yabakhweli kwiinqwelomoya yayinesiphithiphithi, njengoko babegcinwe belindile kwindlela yeenqwelomoya nakwisikhululo sazo iiyure.

eng: Zimmerman was told she had tested negative at 4 a.m., almost 18 hours after landing in Amsterdam, but said she then found out she was standing right next to a man who knew he had tested positive for an infection.
xho: UZimmerman waxelelwa ukuba ufunyaniswe engenaso esisifo ngentsimbi yesi-4 kusasa, phantse kwiiyure ezili-18 emva kokufika e-Amsterdam, kodwa wathi emva koko wafumanisa ukuba wayemi ecaleni kwendoda eyayisazi ukuba yona inaso esisifo.

eng: It was really weird.
xho: “Yayingummangaliso ngokwenene.

eng: There was no coordination.
xho: Kwakungekho kulungelelaniswa.

eng: There were too few people and there really wasnt anybody who took control."
xho: Kwakukho abantu abambalwa kwaye kungekho mntu ulawulayo."

eng: Having spent hours on a flight that likely had many infected passengers made Zimmerman anxious for the days to come, she said.
xho: Emveni kokuchitha iiyure kwinqwelomoya ekusenokwenzeka ukuba inabakhweli abaninzi abosulelekileyo kwenza uZimmerman wanexhala iintsuku, utshilo.

eng: Ive been told that they expect that a lot more people will test positive after five days.
xho: “Ndixelelwe ukuba balindele ukuba baninzi abantu abaza kufunyanwa banaso esisifo emva kweentsuku ezintlanu.

eng: It's a little scary the idea that you've been in a plane with a lot of people who tested positive."
xho: Inendawo eyothusayo into yokuba ubukwinqwelomoya enabantu abaninzi abafunyaniswe ukuba banaso esisifo.”

eng: The Dutch flight ban does not mean that all flights from southern Africa to the Netherlands are halted, as Dutch citizens are allowed to return home, while EU citizens are allowed entry in transit to their home countries.
xho: Ukuvalwa kwenqwelomoya zaseDutch akuthethi ukuba zonke iinqwelomoya ezisuka eMazantsi e-Afrika zisiya eNetherlands ziyanqunyanyiswa, njengoko abemi baseDutchi bevumelekile ukuba babuyele ekhaya, ngelixa abemi be-EU bevumelekile ukuba bangene kumazwe abo.

eng: Medical staff, airline crews and people with pressing needs are also still allowed to travel.
xho: Abasebenzi bezempilo, abasebenzi beenqwelo moya kunye nabantu abanezidingo ezicinezelayo basavumelekile ukuba bahambe.

eng: KLM will continue flights to the region, but travelers need to stay in quarantine for at least five days upon arrival in the Netherlands.
xho: I-KLM iya kuqhubekeka ineenqwelomoya eziya kulo mmandla, kodwa abahambi kunyanzelekile ukuba bahlale bodwa kangangeentsuku ezintlanu xa befika eNetherlands.

eng: The new variant has been detected just as many European countries are grappling with a surge in coronavirus cases.
xho: Uhlobo olutsha lwesisifo lufunyaniswe ngethuba amazwe amaninzi aseYurophu exakene nokwenyuka kwamanani abantu abane-coronavirus.

eng: The Dutch government on Friday announced the nighttime closure of bars, restaurants and most stores as it tries to curb a record-breaking wave of COVID-19 cases that is swamping its health care system.
xho: NgoLwesihlanu urhulumente waseDutch ubhengeze ukuvalwa ebusuku kweebhari, iivenkile zokutyela kunye neevenkile ezininzi njengoko ezama ukunqanda irekhodi elophula irekhodi lwabantu abanesifo i-COVID-19 egxobha inkqubo yakhe yezempilo.

eng: EU to Suspend Travel From Southern Africa Over New COVID Variant
xho: I-EU iyakunqumamisa ukuhanjelwa ngabantu abasuka eMazantsi e-Afrika ngenxa ye-COVID entsha eyahlukileyo

eng: European Union states have agreed to suspend travel from southern Africa after the detection of a new COVID-19 variant, the presidency of the EU said Friday.
xho: Amazwe e-European Union avumile ukumisa ukuhanjelwa ngabantu abasuka kuMazantsi e-Afrika emva kokubhaqwa kolunye uhlobo olutsha lwe-COVID-19, umongameli we-EU uthethe wenjenjalo ngoLwesihlanu.

eng: A committee of health experts from all 27 EU states "agreed on the need to activate the emergency break & impose temporary restriction on all travel into EU from southern Africa," the Slovenian presidency of the EU said on Twitter.
xho: Ikomiti yeengcali zezempilo ezisuka kuwo onke amazwe angama-27 e-EU "avumelene ngesidingo sokubeka ikhefu likaxakeka kwaye abeke uthintelo lwexeshana lokumisa konke ukuhamba okuya e-EU kusuka eMazantsi e-Afrika," utshilo umongameli waseSlovenia we-EU kuTwitter.

eng: Restrictions will apply to Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa and Zimbabwe, European Commission spokesperson Eric Mamer said on Twitter.
xho: Izithintelo zimiselwe iBotswana, iEswatini, iLesotho, iMozambique, iNamibia, iMzantsi Afrika kunye neZimbabwe, satsho isithethi seEuropean Commission uEric Mamer ku-Twitter.

eng: An EU official said that EU governments have also been asked to discourage travel to those countries.
xho: Igosa le-EU lathi oorhulumente be-EU baye bacelwa ukuba bangakukhuthazi ukuya kula mazwe.

eng: Each of the 27 EU countries is free to apply the new measures when it prefers. Some are already applying restrictions.
xho: Ilizwe ngalinye kumazwe angama-27 e-EU likhululekile ukusebenzisa imilinganiselo emitsha ngokuthanda kwalo. Amanye sele ebesebenzisa imiqathango.

eng: EU officials said that no decision had yet been made on other countries in other parts of the world where cases were detected, which include Hong Kong, Israel and Belgium, an EU country.
xho: Amagosa e-EU athi akukabikho sigqibo senziweyo malunga namanye amazwe akwezinye iindawo zehlabathi apho kufunyenwe khona oluhlobo lwesisifo, amazwe aquka iHong Kong, Israel kunye neBelgium, ilizwe le-EU.

eng: Global alarm
xho: Uloyiko lwehlabathi

eng: The new coronavirus variant, first detected in South Africa, has caused global alarm as researchers seek to find out if it is vaccine-resistant.
xho: Uhlobo lutsha lwe-coronavirus, olufunyenwe kuqala eMzantsi Afrika, lubangele uloyiko ehlabathini njengoko abaphandi befuna ukufumanisa ukuba ingaba luyanyangeka na ngogonyo.

eng: Marc Van Ranst, the virologist who detected the new variant in Belgium, told Reuters it was more likely the infected woman had contracted the variant in Belgium rather than while traveling outside Europe.
xho: UMarc Van Ranst, ugqirha wentsholongwane ofumene uhlobo olutsha eBelgium, uxelele iReuters ukuba kunokwenzeka ukuba lo wasethyini usuleleke loluhlobo lutsha lwesisifo eBelgium kunokuba usuleleke nethuba ehambele ngaphandle kweYurophu.

eng: She had been in Egypt earlier in November but developed symptoms only 11 days after her return to Belgium. She is not vaccinated.
xho: Ebehambele e-Egypt ekuqaleni kukaNovemba kodwa waba neempawu kuphela kwiintsuku ezili-11 emva kokubuyela kwakhe eBelgium. Akagonywanga.

eng: Switzerland imposed on Friday a requirement of 10-day quarantine and a negative test for travelers from Belgium, Israel and Hong Kong, in addition to travel bans on southern African countries.
xho: ISwitzerland ngoLwesihlanu ibeke isidingo sokuba umntu avalelwe yedwa iintsuku ezili-10 kunye novavanyo oluthi akunaso esisifo kubahambi abavela eBelgium, eIsrael kunye naseHong Kong, ukongeza kwizithintelo zabahambi abasuka kumazwe aseMazantsi e-Afrika.

eng: Italy Imposes Entry Ban on Eight Southern African States
xho: I-Italy ibeka umthetho wokuvalwa kwayo kubantu abasuka kwamazwe asibhozo akuMazantsi e-Afrika

eng: Italy imposed an entry ban Friday on people who have visited any one of eight southern African states in the last 14 days, because of the spread of a new COVID-19 variant there.
xho: I-Italy ibeke uthetho wokuvalwa kwayo ngolwesiHlanu kubantu abakhe bandwendwela naliphi na ilizwe kumazwe asibhozo aseMazantsi e-Afrika kwezi ntsuku zili-14 zidlulileyo, ngenxa yokusasazeka kodidi olutsha lwe-COVID-19 khona.

eng: Italian Health Minister Roberto Speranza signed an executive order banning entry of travelers from South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, Malawi, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Namibia and Eswatini.
xho: Umphathiswa wezempilo e-Italy uRoberto Speranza utyikitye umyalelo olawulayo wokuvalelwa kwabahambi abavela eMzantsi Afrika, eLesotho, eBotswana, eMalawi, eZimbabwe, eMozambique, eNamibia nase-Eswatini.

eng: Our scientists are studying the new B.1.1.529 variant.
xho: “Iinzululwazi zethu zifunda uhlobo olutsha lwe-B.1.1.529.

eng: In the meantime, we will adopt the greatest possible caution," Speranza said.
xho: Okwangalomzuzu, siza kuthatha esona silumkiso sibalaseleyo,”utshilo uSperanza.

eng: Zimbabwe Environmentalists Demand More Than Rhetoric on Climate Change
xho: Iingcali zokusingqongileyo zaseZimbabwe zifuna ngaphezulu malunga nentetho ngoTshintsho lweMozulu

eng: Environmentalists in Zimbabwe are reacting angrily to President Emmerson Mnangagwa's address at the COP26 conference, where he pledged his government's fight against deforestation and climate change.
xho: Iingcali zokusingqungileyo eZimbabwe ziphendule ngomsindo kwintetho kaMongameli uEmmerson Mnangagwa kwinkomfa ye-COP26, apho athembise ngokulwa kukarhulumente wakhe esilwela ngokuchaseneyo nokugawulwa kwamahlathi kunye nokutshintsha kwemozulu.

eng: Environmentalists say the government is busy dishing out land to companies, mainly Chinese, to mine coal for energy use, which COP26 wants phased out.
xho: Iingcali zokusingqungileyo zithi urhulumente uxakekile enikezela ngomhlaba kwiinkampani, ingakumbi ezamaTshayina, ukuba zembe amalahle ukuze zisebenzise amandla, nto leyo i-COP26 ifuna apheliswe.

eng: Tuesday in Scotland, President Emmerson Mnangagwa addressed the 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference, known as COP26, where he urged developed countries to pay for causing global warming by emitting gases into the atmosphere.
xho: NgoLwesibini eSkotlani, uMongameli uEmmerson Mnangagwa uthethe kwiNkomfa yeZizwe eziManyeneyo yoTshintsho lweMozulu ka-2021, eyaziwa ngokuba yiCOP26, apho ebongoze amazwe aphuhlileyo ukuba ahlawule ngokubangela ukufudumala kwehlabathi ngokukhupha iigesi emoyeni.

eng: He said developing nations like Zimbabwe were paying for the consequences of those emissions.
xho: Uthe amazwe asaphuhlayo afana neZimbabwe ahlawula iziphumo zoko kukhutshwa komoya ongcolileyo.

eng: He also pledged his countrys cooperation in the fight against climate change.
xho: Ukwathembise ngentsebenziswano lelizwe lakhe kumlo ochasene nokutshintsha kwemozulu.

eng: Zimbabwe has revised its nationally determined contributions, a committed conditional 40% per capita greenhouse gas emissions reduction target by 2030.
xho: “IZimbabwe iye yalihlaziya igalelo layo elimiselwe kuzwelonke, ukuzimisela okunemiqathango engama-40% ngomntu ngamnye ekujoliswe ekunciphiseni kokukhutshwa kwegesi engcolisayo ngo-2030.

eng: Comprehensive strategies are being implemented towards mainstreaming climate change adaptation and resilience across all sectors of our economy," Mnangagwa said.
xho: Amaqhinga abanzi ayaphunyezwa ekumiseleni uhlengahlengiso lokutshintsha kwemozulu kunye nokomelela kuwo onke amacandelo oqoqosho lwethu, utshilo uMnangagwa.

eng: This comes at a time when environmentalists in Zimbabwe are asking the government to revoke an exploration license recently awarded to a Chinese company to mine coal for energy use.
xho: Oku kuvele kanye xa iingcaki zokusingqungileyo eZimbabwe zicela urhulumente ukuba arhoxise iphepha-mvume lokuhlola elinikwe inkampani yase China ukuba imbe amalahle ukuze isebenzise amandla awo.

eng: The Center for Natural Resource Governance is one of the organizations opposing the license.
xho: Iziko loLawulo lweMithombo yeNdalo ngomnye wemibutho ephikisana nokunikezelwa kweli phepha-mvume.

eng: The group promotes green energy, and fears that exploration for coal will cause greater deforestation.
xho: Eli qela likhuthaza amandla ohlaza, kwaye liloyiko lokuba ukusetyenziswa  kwamalahle kubangela ukutshatyalaliswa kwamahlathi okugqithisileyo.

eng: Henry Nyapokoto, the program manager for the group, said Mnangagwas comments run contrary to what he sees going on.
xho: UHenry Nyapokoto, umphathi wenkqubo yeli qela, uthe izimvo zikaMnangagwa zihamba ngokuchasene noko akubona kusenzeka.

eng: But the government has been in overdrive mode to promote mining everywhere in order to reach the $12 billion mining economy.
xho: “Kodwa urhulumente ebekwimo esebenza ngokugqithisileyo ukukhuthaza imigodi kuyo yonke indawo ukuze kufikelelwe kuqoqosho lwemigodi yeebhiliyoni eziyi-12 zeedola.

eng: In fact, it wont (make) ecological sense for Zimbabwe to attain a $12 billion economy based on bad models of production, bad consumption, that leaves a huge ecological footprint or a legacy of an ecological disaster.
xho: Kunjalo nje, ayenzi ngqiqo yendalo ukuba iZimbabwe ifumane uqoqosho lweedola ezili-12 leebhiliyoni ezisekelwe kwiindlela ezimbi zemveliso, ukusetyenziswa okungalunganga, okushiya kusetyesiswe indawo enkulu yendalo okanye ilifa lentlekele yendalo.

eng: We all understand that mining comes with destruction of forests that serves as carbon sinks and habitat for wildlife," Nyapokoto said.
xho: Sonke siyaqonda ukuba imigodi iza nokutshatyalaliswa kwamahlathi asebenza njengendawo yokucoca umoya nendawo apho izilwanyana zasendle zihlala khona,” utshilo uNyapokoto.

eng: Nyapokoto added that Zimbabwe was exploring oil and gas on its northeast border with Zambia, another project that could lead to deforestation.
xho: UNyapokoto wongeze wathi iZimbabwe ihlola ioyile negesi kumda wayo osemntla-mpuma neZambia, enye yezinto enokukhokelela ekutshatyalalisweni kwamahlathi.

eng: Despite the impact of oil and gas on global warming, there will be (a) visible, immediate direct effect of this oil and gas mining on local communities or ecosystems.
xho: Ngaphandle kwempembelelo yeoyile kunye negesi kukufudumala kwehlabathi, kuza kubakho (a) isiphumo esicacileyo, esithe ngqo sale migodi yeoli kunye negesi kuluntu okanye kwinqkubo yendalo.

eng: Land will be cleared for mining and other infrastructure that is going to support that mining.
xho: Umhlaba uya kucocwa ukwenzela imigodi nezinye iziseko zophuhliso eziza kuxhasa loo migodi.

eng: That is contrary to the greening of the economy that they are talking about in Glasgow," Nyapokoto said.
xho: Oku kuchasene nokwenza luhlaza uqoqosho abathetha ngalo eGlasgow,” utshilo uNyapokoto.

eng: He said Zimbabwe was in the top 10 of countries of deforestation, with about 300,000 hectares of forests destroyed annually.
xho: Uthe iZimbabwe ikwishumi lamazwe aphambili ekutshatyalalwisweni kwamahlathi, malunga neehektare ezingama-300,000 zamahlathi ezithi zigawulwe ngonyaka.

eng: But Byron Zamasiya of the Zimbabwe Environmental Law Association says Mnangagwa was genuine in his COP26 address about fighting deforestation caused by need for energy.
xho: Kodwa uByron Zamasiya weZimbabwe Environmental Law Association uthi uMnangagwa wayenyanisekile kwintetho yakhe yeCOP26 malunga nokulwa ukugawulwa kwamahlathi okubangelwa sisidingo sokusebenzisa amandla ombane.

eng: So, the issue of fighting deforestation is a key ingredient for addressing greenhouse gas emissions for Zimbabwe.
xho: “Kungoko ke, umba wokulwa ukutshatyalaliswa kwamahlathi yeyona nto iphambili ekufuneka inikwe iingqwalasela malunga nokukhutshwa kwegreenhouse gas eZimbabwe.

eng: The trees act as a carbon sink since they absorb carbon dioxide, which is a major cause of global warming.
xho: Imithi isebenza njengendawo yokucoca umoya njengoko ifunxa icarbon dioxide, eyona nto ingunobangela wokufudumala kwehlabathi.

eng: What we may want as a country is to make available alternative sources of energy, especially for the rural communities who rely on wood fuel and account for the major part of deforestation.
xho: Into esinokuyifuna njengelizwe kukufumana eminye imithombo yamandla ombane ekhoyo, ingakumbi kuluntu lwasemaphandleni oluthembele kumafutha eenkuni kwaye olunenxalenye enkulu ekugawuleni imithi.

eng: We may also need to promote intensive farming methods as opposed to extensive farming methods that require bigger fields and the clearing of new forests for fields," Zamasiya said.
xho: Kuunganyanzeleka ukuba sikhuthaze iindlela zokulima ngokunzulu ngokuchasene neendlela ezibanzi zokulima ezifuna amasimi amakhulu kunye nokutshatyalaliswa kwamahlathi amatsha ukwenzela amasimi,” utshilo uZamasiya.

eng: The Environmental Management Agency in Zimbabwe has been fining people caught cutting or burning forests. But so far, that hasnt stopped the trees from coming down.
xho: IArhente yoLawulo lokusiNgqongileyo eZimbabwe ihlawulise abantu ababanjwe begawula okanye betshisa imithi. Kodwa ukuza kuthi ga ngoku, oko akukunciphisanga ukutshatyalaliswa kweimithi.

eng: Young Africans Struggle With Jobs, Education Amid Pandemic
xho: Abantu abatsha base-Afrika basokola ukufumana imisebenzi, imfundo phakathi kwesifo selizwe lonke.

eng: The future looked promising for Tinashe Mapuranga, an intern at a leading bank in Zimbabwe who appeared set to get a staff position as soon as he completed his college degree.
xho: Ikamva belikade libonakala lithembisa kuTinashe Mapuranga, umfundi oqeqeshelwa umsebenzi kwibhanki enqenqeza phambili eZimbabwe nothe wabonakala engathi angafumana isikhundla somsebenzi akugqiba izifundo zakhe sasekholeji.

eng: Then the COVID-19 pandemic hit.
xho: Emva koko isifo esichaphazela izwelonke i-COVID-19 safika.

eng: Amid the lockdowns, the 24-year-old was one of the first to be laid off and has no idea when he'll be able to get his degree because of frequent school closures.
xho: Ngelixa kuvaliwe, lo mfo uneminyaka engama-24 waba ngomnye wabokuqala ukugxothwa kwaye akanalo nofifi lokuba uya kukwazi nini ukufumana isidanga sakhe ngenxa yusoloqo kuvalwa izikolo.

eng: It has really affected me a lot in my studies.
xho: Indichaphazele kakhulu ezifundweni zam.

eng: I have no money to buy data and I don't have a personal laptop to study online and keep up like what others are doing," said Mapuranga, who lives with his mother in Chitungwiza, a sprawling working-class area southeast of Harare, the capital.
xho: Andinayo imali yokuthenga idatha kwaye andinayo ilaptop yokufunda kwi-Intanethi ukuze ndiqhubeke njengoko abanye beqhuba, utshilo uMapuranga, ohlala nomama wakhe eChitungwiza, indawo ethe tyaba yabasebenzi kumazantsi mpuma eHarare. ikomkhulu.

eng: I was supposed to finish in November or December 2021, but as of now, we haven't completed much of the work," he said.
xho: “Bekufanele ukuba ndiyagqiba ngoNovemba okanye ngoDisemba ka-2021, kodwa okwangoku, asikabiphi nomsebenzi omninzi,” utshilo.

eng: Truly speaking, I am not sure when I will finish the degree. I can't wait to graduate and find a job and do something tangible in life."
xho: Xa ndithetha inyani, andiqinisekanga ukuba ndizakuzigqiba nini izifundo. ingathi andide digqibe ndifumane umsebenzi ndenze into ebonakalayo ebomini.

eng: Mapuranga spends most of his time at home, tending a tiny vegetable garden that is the family's main source of food.
xho: UMapuranga ixesha elininzi ulichitha esekhaya, ehoyene negadi encinci yemifuno  engumthombo wokutya kolu sapho.

eng: His mother ekes out a living traveling to South Africa to sell things like stone carvings and brooms on the streets, a trade also badly hit by the pandemic.
xho: Umama wakhe uzama ukuphila ngokuthi ahambela eMzantsi Afrika ayokuthengisa ezitalatweni izinto ezifana nemizobo yamatye kunye nemitshayelo, imveliso achaphazeleke kakubi sisifo esihlasela uzwelonke.

eng: We've been trying to hustle to get some money," he said.
xho: “Besizama ukusebenza ukuze sifumane imali,"utshilo.

eng: I tried to do a small business selling cooking gas but the authorities chased us away from the streets.
xho: “Ndizamile ukwenza ishishini elincinci lokuthengisa igesi yokupheka kodwa abasemagunyeni basigxotha ezitalatweni.

eng: My father passed away.
xho: Utata wasweleka.

eng: My mother is into informal business, but it's also down with these lockdowns.
xho: Umama ukwishishini elingekho sikweni, kodwa litsala nzima ngenxa yokuvalwa kwezinto.

eng: Things are not well right now. It's tough."
xho: Izinto azihambi kakuhle ngoku. kunzima."

eng: Mapuranga's situation might look dire, but he says he's concerned about some of his unemployed peers who have fallen into alcohol, drugs and prostitution.
xho: Imeko kaMapuranga ingajongeka inzima, kodwa uthi uxhalabile ngoongxa bakhe abangenamisebenzi abathe baziphosa etywaleni, kwiziyobisi nasekubeni bathengise ngemizimba.

eng: Many youths have lost hope," he said.
xho: “Abantu abatsha abaninzi baphelelwe lithemba,” watsho.

eng: Across Africa, many others like Mapuranga are battling the economic downturn caused by COVID-19, losing jobs and seeing their education disrupted, a survey of people aged 18-24 in 15 countries.
xho: Kwi-Afrika jikelele, abanye abaninzi abafana noMapuranga bajijisana nokuhla kwezinga loqoqosho okubangelwa yi-COVID-19, balahlekelwa yimisebenzi kwaye babona ukuphazamiseka kwezifundo zabo, uphando lwabantu abaneminyaka ephakathi kwe-18-24 kumazwe ali-15.

eng: The pandemic increased the already-high level of unemployment among the group, according to preliminary findings of the second annual Africa Youth Survey.
xho: Isifo esihlasela ihlabathi sonyuse inqanaba elisele liphezulu lentswela-ngqesho phakathi kweqela, ngokweziphumo zokuqala zophando lwesibini lonyaka leAfrican Youth Survey.

eng: Nearly 20% of the 4,500 respondents said they became unemployed because of the pandemic and 37% were forced to stop or pause their education.
xho: Phantse i-20% yabantu abaphendulileyo kubantu abangama-4,500 bathi baphelelwa ngumsebenzi ngenxa yesifo esihlasele ilizwe lonke kwaye i-37% banyanzeleka ukuba bayeke okanye bazimise izifundo zabo.

eng: Another 8% saw their pay docked, 18% had to move back home and 10% said they had to care for family members, according to the survey, which was commissioned by the Johannesburg-based Ichikowitz Family Foundation, whose founder, Ivor Ichikowitz, runs Paramount Group, an aerospace, security and military contractor.
xho: Abanye ayi-8% bawubonile umvuzo wabo, i-18% kwafuneka ukuba babuyele emakhaya kwaye i-10% yathi kufuneka inyamekele amalungu osapho, ngokophando, olwagunyaziswa yi-Ichikowitz Family Foundation eseRhawutini, umseki wayo u-Ivor Ichikowitz. ophethe iParamount Group, inkampani esebenza nge-aerospace, ukhuseleko kunye nekontraka yomkhosi.

eng: Of the 1.3 billion people in Africa's 54 countries, an estimated 250 million are aged 18-24.
xho: Kubantu abayi-1.3 sebhiliyoni abakumazwe angama-54 aseAfrika, kuqikelelwa ukuba ama-250 ezigidi baphakathi kweminyaka eli-18 ukuya ku-24 ubudala.

eng: The study was conducted in major urban and trading centers in Angola, Congo, The Republic of Congo, Ethopia, Gabon, Kenya, Malawi, Mozambique
xho: Uphononongo lwenziwe kumaziko amakhulu eedolophu eAngola, eCongo, kwiRepublic of Congo, eEthopia, eGhabon, eGhana, eKenya, eMalawi, eMozambique

eng: Nigeria, Rwanda, South Africa, Sudan, Uganda and Zambia.
xho: eNigeria, eRwanda, eMzantsi Afrika, eSudan, eUganda naseZambia.

eng: The researchers for PSB Insights, a global polling company, were nationals of each country where the survey took place and went door-to-door for in-depth, face-to-face interviews.
xho: Abaphandi be-PSB Insights, inkampani yokuvota yehlabathi, apho abemi belizwe ngalinye kwiindawo apho uphando luqhutywe khona kwaye kungenwa kwindlu nganye kusenziwa udliwano-ndlebe olunzulu, ubuso ngobuso.

eng: People surveyed said the pandemic caused substantial disruptions to their schooling, emphasizing the need for more computers and internet access in Africa for online education.
xho: Abantu abathathe inxaxheba yophando bathi esisifo sikazwelonke sibangela ukuphazamiseka okukhulu kwizifundo zabo, begxininisa kwimfuneko yeekhompyuter ezongezelelweyo kunye nokufikeleleka kwe-intanethi e-Afrika kwimfundo ye-Intanethi.

eng: Bola Badejo, 29, saw her salary at the broadcast station where she worked in Abuja, Nigeria, cut in half, and she complained that she could not make it on the equivalent of $146 a month.
xho: UBola Badejo, oneminyaka engama-29 ubudala, wabona umvuzo wakhe kwisikhululo sosasazo apho wayesebenza khona e-Abuja, eNigeria, inqunyulwa phakathi, yaye wakhalaza ngelithi wayengenakukwazi ukuphila ngemali elingana ne-146 yeedola ngenyanga.

eng: I was already poor and I was working just for the sake of doing the job," she said. Then, in April 202, she was laid off.
xho: “Ndandihleli ndisokola kwaye ndisebenzela nje ukwenza umsebenzi,” utshilo. Kwandula ke, ngoAprili 202, wagxothwa emsebenzini.

eng: I fell into depression because the whole thing was really sad. I felt I had nowhere to go," Badejo said.
xho: Wakhathazeka emphefumlweni ngenxa yokuba yonke into yayibuhlungu ngokwenene. Ndaziva ndingenayo indawo yokuya, kusho uBadejo.

eng: After seven months without a job, she started a home cleaning business, and that has boosted her outlook, she said.
xho: Emva kweenyanga ezisixhenxe engenawo umsebenzi, uye waqalisa ishishini lokucoca amakhaya, kwaye oko kuye kwaqaqambisa indlela abona ngayo izinto, utshilo.

eng: Badejo is typical of many who have found different ways to support themselves.
xho: I-Badejo yinto eqhelekileyo kwabaninzi abaye bafumana iindlela ezahlukeneyo zokuzixhasa.

eng: In 2020, about 40% of those surveyed expressed optimism about the future.
xho: Ngo-2020, malunga nama-40% yabo bathathe inxaxheba kuphando babonise ukuba nethemba ngengomso.

eng: The pandemic dented that confidence, lowering it to 31%, according to the survey.
xho: Isifo kikazwelonke  sehlise kuzithemba, lehle lafika ku-31%, ngokutsho kophando.

eng: Uganda has had two lockdowns since April 2020, the second of which was relaxed in July. But businesses involving close human interaction — bars, gyms and nightclubs — remain closed by presidential order, leaving many young people without work.
xho: I-Uganda ivalwe kwade kwakabini ukusukela ngo-Epreli ka-2020, ekwesibini okwaku ngekho ngamadla ngoJulayi. Kodwa amashishini abandakanya intsebenziswano esondeleyo yabantu - iindawo zotywala, iindawo zokuzilolonga kunye neendawo zomjuxuzo zasebusuku - zahlala zivaliwe ngokomyalelo kamongameli, eshiya abantu abatsha abaninzi bengenamsebenzi.

eng: Ronald Maathe, a 25-year-old janitor at a gym outside Uganda's capital of Kampala, shook his head sorrowfully when saying that his monthly salary is now the equivalent of $43.
xho: URonald Maathe, oneminyaka engama-25 ubudala, ongumgcini wesakhiwo kwindawo yokuzilolonga ngaphandle kwekomkhulu laseUganda eKampala, wanyikinya intloko esiva kabuhlungu xa esithi umvuzo wakhe wenyanga ngoku ulingana ne-$43.

eng: That's half of what he used to earn before the pandemic.
xho: Esi sisiqingatha sento awayeqhele ukuyifumana ngaphambi kwesisifo sikazwelonke.

eng: After I pay the rent, I am left with almost nothing," he said.
xho: “Emva kokuba ndihlawule irenti, ndishiyeke ndingenanto,” utshilo.

eng: The half salary doesn't do anything."
xho: Isiqingatha somvuzo asindenzeli nto.

eng: His face lights up when describing how he makes ends meet by selling passion fruit — or grenadillas — that he buys from farmers near the border with Congo.
xho: Ubuso bakhe buyakhazimla xa ethetha ngendlela aziphilisa ngayo ngokuthengisa ipassion fruit - okanye iigrenadillas - azithenga kumafama akufutshane nomda weCongo.

eng: He makes a small profit on every sack of fruit he sells in Kampala.
xho: Wenza inzuzo encinci kwingxowa nganye yeziqhamo azithengisayo eKampala.

eng: My business is still small.
xho: “Ishishini lam liselincinane.

eng: But I have a dream," he said.
xho: Kodwa ndinephupha,” watsho.

eng: If I can get someone to hold my hand, and give me a loan to expand my business, that's what I want.
xho: “Ukuba ndingafumana umntu ozakubambisana nam, andinike imali-mboleko yokwandisa ishishini lam, yile nto ndiyifunayo.

eng: I am not waiting for the government to help me."
xho: Andilindelanga ukuba urhulumente andincede.

eng: Red Cross: 48,000 People Confirmed Missing Across Africa
xho: IRed Cross: ngabantu abangama-48,000 akuqinisekiweyo ukuba balahlekile kwi-Afrika jikelele.

eng: The International Committee of the Red Cross says more than 48,000 people are missing across Africa, and at least 21,600 are minors.
xho: I-International Committee ye-Red Cross ithi bangaphezu kwe-48,000 abantu abalahlekileyo kwi-Afrika iphela, kwaye ubuncinane abayi-21,600 ngabantwana.

eng: Most of the registered disappearances — widely believed to be a fraction of the continents wider, undocumented humanitarian tragedy — are linked to armed conflict, violence, disasters and migration across the continent.
xho: Uninzi lwababhalisiweyo abanyamaleleyo - okukholelwa ngokubanzi ukuba liqhezu lelizwekazi elibanzi, intlekele yobuntu engabhalwanga - inxulunyaniswe nongquzulwano oluxhobileyo, ubundlobongela, iintlekele kunye nokufudukela kwilizwekazi liphela.

eng: The International Committee of the Red Cross says the number of people coming forward to report missing persons is on the rise in Africa.
xho: I-International Committee yombutho weRed Cross ithi liyanda inani labantu abaza phambili bazokuxela abantu abalahlekileyo eAfrika jikelele.

eng: Amaya Fernandez, the humanitarian organizations adviser on the missing and their families for Western Africa, says the cause of the increasing numbers is two-fold.
xho: U-Amaya Fernandez, ongumcebisi wemibutho yoluntu lwabalahlekileyo kunye neentsapho zabo eNtshona Afrika, uthi unobangela wokunyuka kwamanani kuphindwe kabini.

eng: On one hand, [it's] due to the fact we are trying to register more systematically cases of missing persons throughout the region.
xho: “Kwesinye isandla, kungenxa yokuba sizama ukubhalisa amatyala abantu abalahlekileyo mmandla uphel.

eng: But also, certainly, [it's] due to the increased violence and conflict experienced on the continent, which increases at the same time the likelihood of people going missing.
xho: Kodwa kwakhona, ngokuqinisekileyo, kungenxa yokuba kwande undlobongela kunye nongquzulwano olufunyenwe kwilizwekazi, kwangaxeshanye lunyusa amathuba okuba abantu balahleke umphelo.

eng: Looking at our figures, almost half of the missing persons have been recorded underage and most of them are men.
xho: Xa kujongwa amanani ethu, phantse isiqingatha sabantu abalahlekileyo ngabantwana abancinci kwaye uninzi lwabo ngamadoda.

eng: Among the women ... we can see that the majority are minors," she said.
xho: Phakathi kwabantu ababhinqileyo...siyabona ukuba uninzi ngabantwana, utshilo.

eng: The ICRC finding shows that 39,360 of the 48,000 missing people are from seven countries with armed conflicts.
xho: Ukufunyanwa kwe-ICRC kubonisa ukuba abantu abayi 39,360 abalahlekileyo kubantu abayi-48,000 bavela kumazwe asixhenxe aneengxabano ezixhobileyo.

eng: According to the Stockholm International Peace and Research Institute, 20 countries in Africa have armed conflict.
xho: Ngokutsho kweStockholm International Peace and Research Institute, amazwe angama-20 aseAfrika anongquzulwano ngezixhobo.

eng: Out of the 20, 10 are witnessing high-intensity armed conflicts.
xho: Kumazwe angama-20, ali-10 abona ungquzulwano oluqatha.

eng: Fernandez says the ongoing conflict in some African countries has created more pain and suffering for families of missing persons.
xho: UFernandez uthi ungquzulwano oluqhubekayo kumazwe athile eAfrika lubangele intlungu engakumbi kunye nokubandezeleka kwiintsapho zabo abalahlekileyo.

eng: Humanitarian consequences... caused by protracted armed conflicts are often... reflected in most of the interviews.
xho: Iziphumo zobuntu... ezibangelwa lungquzulwano oluxhobileyo oluthatha ixesha elide luhlala lubonakala  kudliwano-ndlebe.

eng: For instance, half of the families interviewed in Nigeria reported that their relatives had gone missing in 2014-2015.
xho: Umzekelo, isiqingatha seentsapho ezifumane udliwano-ndlebe eNigeria zaxela ukuba izalamane zabo zilahlekile ngo-2014-2015.

eng: [In] South Sudan, [the] majority of the families were looking for people that went missing between 2013 and 2016.
xho: E-South Sudan, uninzi lwezizalwane bezikhangela abantu abalahlekileyo phakathi kweminyaka u-2013 no-2016.

eng: In Libya, families reported that they were looking for missing relatives from the late '70s until the present day, and the same goes for families in Ethiopia and Uganda," she said.
xho: E-Libya, izizalwane zitshilo ukuba zikhangela izalamane zazo ezilahlekileyo ukusukela kwiminyaka yoo-70 ukuzokuthi ga ngoku, kwaye kuyafana ngokunjalo kwabo base-Ethiopia nase-Uganda,”utshilo.

eng: Some experts see the need to train community workers and security agencies on the importance of information sharing to help locate missing persons.
xho: Ezinye iingcaphephe zibona kunyanzelekile ukuba kuqeqeshwe abasebenzi basekuhlaleni kunye nee-arhente zokhuseleko malunga nokubaluleka kokwabelana ngolwazi ukunceda ukufumana abantu abalahlekileyo.

eng: Zimbabwes assistant police commissioner Crispen Lifa says his country and the region need a data management system to follow up on the missing person cases.
xho: Umncedisi womkomishinala wamapolisa eZimbabwe uCrispen Lifa uthi ilizwe lakhe kunye nommandla badinga inkqubo yolawulo lolwazi ukuze kulandelelwe amatyala abantu abadukileyo.

eng: There is a need to have a database which should be continuously updated so that all missing persons, and even those that are deceased... is captured in a database by police stations.
xho: “Kukho isidingo sokuba kubekho uvimba weenkcukacha ekufuneka uhlaziywa ngalo lonke ixesha ukuze bonke abantu abalahlekileyo, kwanabo bangasekhoyo... bafakwe kwiziko ledatha kwizikhululo zamapolisa.

eng: At the end of the day, that information has to be put in place... [so] if you want to check across the country the number of missing persons, [you] would quickly get that information from a central point," he said.
xho: Ekugqibeleni, olo lwazi kunyanzelekile ukuba lubekwe endaweni... ngoko ukuba ufuna ukujonga kwilizwe liphela inani labantu abalahlekileyo, uyakulufumana ngokukhawulezileyo ulwazi kwindawo ephakathi, utshilo.

eng: Fauziya Hussein's brother went missing in June after a Kenyan court released him.
xho: Umninawa kaFauziya Hussein walahleka ngoJuni emva kokukhululwa yinkundla yaseKenya.

eng: The 39-year-old was accused of terrorism-related issues, but the court found him innocent and ordered the police to release him.
xho: Le ndoda ineminyaka engama-39, utyholwa ngemiba edibene nobunqolobi, kodwa inkundla yamfumana engenatyala yaze yayalela ukuba akhululwe ngamapolisa.

eng: His sister, Fauziya Hussein, says they never saw him again.
xho: Udadewabo, uFauziya Hussein, uthi abaphendanga bambona.

eng: I know they still have him. At every point [of his detention], my brother got a chance to make a phone call. He called my mother.
xho: Ndiyayazi ukuba basambambile. Ngalo lonke ixesha awayevalelwe ngalo, umnakwethu wazinika ixesha lokufowuna. Wafowunela umama.

eng: So, if he was released, why didnt he call my mother?
xho: Ngoko ukuba bamkhulula kutheni engamfowuneli umama?

eng: So, I know for a fact they did not release him," she said.
xho: Ngoko, ndiyazi ukuba azange bamkhulule, utshilo.

eng: According to Hussein, police told her they released her brother.
xho: NgokukaHussein, amapolisa amxelela ukuba amkhulule umnakwabo.

eng: The ICRC calls on African governments to prevent disappearances and help with search and identification, and addressing families needs.
xho: I-ICRC icela oorhulumente baseAfrika ukuba bancede banqande ukunyamalala kwabantu ngokuthu kukhangelwe, kuchongwe,  kwaye kujongwe iimfuno zeentsapho ezilahlekelweyo.

eng: Red Cross: 48,000 People Confirmed Missing Across Africa
xho: iRed Cross: Bangama-48,000 abantu ekuqinisekiweyo ukuba balahlekile kwi-Afrika jikelele.

eng: The International Committee of the Red Cross says more than 48,000 people are missing across Africa, and at least 21,600 are minors.
xho: I-International Committee ye-Red Cross ithi bangaphezu kwe-48,000 abantu abalahlekileyo kwi-Afrika iphela, kwaye ubuncinane abayi-21,600 ngabantwana.

eng: Most of the registered disappearances — widely believed to be a fraction of the continents wider, undocumented humanitarian tragedy — are linked to armed conflict, violence, disasters and migration across the continent.
xho: Uninzi lwababhalisiweyo abanyamaleleyo - okukholelwa ngokubanzi ukuba liqhezu lelizwekazi elibanzi, intlekele yobuntu engabhalwanga - inxulunyaniswe nongquzulwano oluxhobileyo, ubundlobongela, iintlekele kunye nokufudukela kwilizwekazi liphela.

eng: The International Committee of the Red Cross says the number of people coming forward to report missing persons is on the rise in Africa.
xho: I-International Committee yombutho weRed Cross ithi liyanda inani labantu abaza phambili bazokuxela abantu abalahlekileyo eAfrika jikelele.

eng: Amaya Fernandez, the humanitarian organizations adviser on the missing and their families for Western Africa, says the cause of the increasing numbers is two-fold.
xho: U-Amaya Fernandez, ongumcebisi wemibutho yoluntu lwabalahlekileyo kunye neentsapho zabo eNtshona Afrika, uthi unobangela wokunyuka kwamanani kuphindwe kabini.

eng: On one hand, [it's] due to the fact we are trying to register more systematically cases of missing persons throughout the region.
xho: “Kwesinye isandla, kungenxa yokuba sizama ukubhalisa amatyala abantu abalahlekileyo kummandla uphela.

eng: But also, certainly, [it's] due to the increased violence and conflict experienced on the continent, which increases at the same time the likelihood of people going missing.
xho: Kodwa kwakhona, ngokuqinisekileyo, kungenxa yokuba kwande undlobongela kunye nongquzulwano olufunyanwa kwilizwekazi, kwangaxeshanye lunyusa amathuba okuba abantu balahleke umphelo.

eng: Looking at our figures, almost half of the missing persons have been recorded underage and most of them are men.
xho: Xa kujongwa amanani ethu, phantse isiqingatha sabantu abalahlekileyo ngabantwana abancinci kwaye uninzi lwabo ngabafana.

eng: Among the women ... we can see that the majority are minors," she said.
xho: Phakathi kwabantu ababhinqileyo...siyabona ukuba uninzi ngabantwana, utshilo.

eng: The ICRC finding shows that 39,360 of the 48,000 missing people are from seven countries with armed conflicts.
xho: Ukufunyanwa kwe-ICRC kubonisa ukuba abayii-39,360 abalahlekileyo kubantu abayi-48,000 bavela kumazwe asixhenxe aneengxabano ezixhobileyo.

eng: According to the Stockholm International Peace and Research Institute, 20 countries in Africa have armed conflict.
xho: Ngokutsho kweStockholm International Peace and Research Institute, amazwe angama-20 aseAfrika anongquzulwano ngezixhobo.

eng: Out of the 20, 10 are witnessing high-intensity armed conflicts.
xho: Kumazwe angama-20, ali-10 abona ungquzulwano oluqatha.

eng: Olympics: Post-Bolt Era in 100m Begins in Tokyo
xho: IiOlimpiki: Ixesha le-Post-Bolt kwi-100m Iqala eTokyo

eng: The post-Usain Bolt era in the men's Olympic 100 meters began on Saturday in Tokyo with Dorian Keletela, who is competing as part of the Olympic Refugee team, advancing to the next round with a personal best 10.33 seconds.
xho: Ixesha le-post-Usain Bolt kwi-Olimpiki ye-100 yeemitha zamadoda liqale ngoMgqibelo eTokyo kunye noDorian Keletela, okhuphisanayo njengenxalenye yeqela le-Olympic Refugee, eqhubela phambili kumjikelo olandelayo nge-10.33 yemizuzwana.

eng: Bolt won three straight titles from Beijing in 2008 and his retirement in 2017 has left something of a vacuum in the showpiece athletics event, with no one stepping up to fill the Jamaican's shoes.
xho: UBolt uphumelele izihloko ezithathu ezithe ngqo eBeijing ngo-2008 kwaye umhlala-phantsi wakhe ngo-2017 ushiye umngxuma kumsitho weembaleki, kungekho mntu unyukayo ukuzalisa izihlangu zaseJamaica.

eng: On Saturday, amid stifling temperatures that hovered above 30 degrees Celsius, sprinters took the track as they began their attempts to succeed world-record holder Bolt.
xho: NgoMgqibelo, phakathi kwamaqondo obushushu angaphezulu ku-30, iimbaleki zangena ebaleni njengoko ziqala iinzame zokuphumelela uBolt ophethe irekhodi yehlabathi.

eng: Keletela, 22, is one of those athletes.
xho: UKeletela, oneminyaka engama-22, ngomnye wabo badlali.

eng: Originally from the Democratic Republic of the Congo, he moved to Portugal in 2016 following the death of his parents due to conflict in his homeland and ran a personal best 10.33 to advance to the next round later on Saturday.
xho: Ophuma kwilizwe iDemocratic Republic of the Congo, wafudukela ePortugal ngo-2016 emva kokusweleka kwabazali bakhe ngenxa yongquzulwano kwilizwe lakhe kwaye wabaleka eyona 10.33 engcono ukuya kumjikelo olandelayo kamva ngoMgqibelo.

eng: am very, very proud of this and I am very, very proud of this team.
xho: Ndinebhongo kakhulu ngale nto kwaye ndiyazingca kakhulu ngeli qela.

eng: It gives me a lot of strength to go on," Keletela said after the race.
xho: Kundinika amandla amakhulu okuqhubekeka,” utshilo uKeletela emva kogqatso.

eng: You can do ... anything, whether you are a refugee or not."
xho: Unokwenza ... nantoni na, nokuba uyimbacu okanye awuyiyo.

eng: Others who progressed from the preliminary heats include Zimbabwe's Ngoni Makusha, who got off the block fast to win his heat in 10.32, and Oman's Barakat Al Harthi, who posted 10.27s to win his race.
xho: Abanye abathe baqhubela phambili kwindima yokuqala baquka uNgoni Makusha waseZimbabwe, ophume ngokukhawuleza ukuze aphumelele ugqatso lwakhe ngo-10.32, kunye noBarakat Al Harthi waseOman, obeke i-10.27s ukuphumelela ugqatso lwakhe.

eng: There were three preliminary heats overall and the first three in each heat qualify to round one, along with the athlete who posts the next fastest time.
xho: Kukho izigaba zogqatso ezohlulwe kathathu kwaye abokuqala abathathu kwisigaba ngasinye baphumelela kwisigaba sokuqala, kunye nembaleki ebeka ixesha elilandelayo ngokukhawuleza.

eng: The world's top sprinters enter the equation later Saturday, with the United States, who have won more golds in the event than all other nations combined, determined to take Bolt's mantle and regain their supremacy.
xho: Iimbaleki ezigqwesileyo zehlabathi zingena kule nkquleqhu kamva ngoMgqibelo, kunye ne-United States, ephumelele igolide eninzi kulo mnyhadala ngaphezu kwazo zonke ezinye izizwe zidityanisiwe, zizimisele ukuthabatha ingubo kaBolt kwaye ziphinde zizuze ukongama kwazo.

eng: Their last gold medal win in the event came via Justin Gatlin in 2004.
xho: Imbasa yabo yokugqibela yegolide kulo msitho yeza ngoJustin Gatlin ngo-2004.

eng: Contenders include Trayvon Bromell, whose 9.77 second run in Florida last month is the fastest of the year and propels him into the top tier of favorites in the race.
xho: Abantu abakhuphisanayo baquka uTrayvon Bromell, obaleka imizuzwana eyi-9.77  eFlorida kwinyanga ephelileyo ngoyena ukhawulezayo kulonyaka kwaye oku umqhubele kwinqanaba eliphezulu leentandokazi kugqatso.

eng: His compatriot Ronnie Baker is probably his closest rival for podium positions and finished second to him at the U.S. trials with a time of 9.85.
xho: Umlingane wakhe uRonnie Baker mhlawumbi ungoyena mntu usondeleyo kwizikhundla zeqonga kwaye wagqiba okwesibini kuye kwiimvavanyo zase-US ngemizuzwabz eyi-9.85.

eng: Canada's Andre De Grasse, who won bronze in the 100m in Rio five years ago, will be looking to go for the title this time around while South African sprinter Akani Simbine, fifth in Brazil and boasting the second-fastest time of the year, will also be in the running.
xho: U-Andre De Grasse waseCanada, owaphumelela ubhedu kumgama we-100m eRio kwiminyaka emihlanu edlulileyo, uzakube ejonge ukulwela intshinga kweli tyeli lo gama imbaleki yoMzantsi Afrika, u-Akani Simbine, owaphumelela indawo yesihlanu eBrazil, ezingomba indawo yesibini kulo nyaka. naye uzakungenelela olugqatso.

eng: Bolt's former training partner, 2012 silver medalist Yohan Blake, the second-fastest man in history, will carry his nation's hopes on his shoulders.
xho: Owayesakuba ngugxa kaBolt ekuqeqeshweni, owafumana imbasa yesilivere ngo-2012 u-Yohan Blake, indoda yesibini ngesantya embalini, uzakuthwala amathemba esizwe sakhe emagxeni akhe.

eng: South Africa's Zuma to Pursue Private Prosecution Against Prosecutor
xho: UZuma woMzantsi Afrika uzakuqhuba uTshutshiso lwaBucala ngakuMtshutshisi

eng: Former South African President Jacob Zuma is pursuing private prosecution proceedings to remove the lead prosecutor in an arms deal corruption trial after failed legal challenges, his foundation said on Sunday.
xho: Owayesakuba ngumongameli weli loMzantsi Afrika uJacob Zuma uqhuba iinkqubo zokutshutshisa ukususa umtshutshisi okhokelayo kwityala lobuqhophololo emva kokungaphumeleli kwezomthetho, isiseko sakhe satsho ngeCawe.

eng: Last month the Supreme Court of Appeal (SCA) torpedoed Zuma's latest bid to have lead prosecutor Billy Downer taken off the case after accusing him of bias and leaking of confidential information to a journalist in contravention of the national prosecution act, among other complaints.
xho: Kwinyanga ephelileyo iNkundla ePhakamileyo yeziBheno (SCA) yasikhaba isicelo sikaZuma sokuba umtshutshisi okhokelayo uBilly Downer alishenxise eli tyala emva kokumtyhola ngokukheth’ icala kunye nokupapasha ulwazi oluyimfihlo kwintatheli ngokuchasene nomthetho wesizwe wotshutshiso, phakathi kwezinye izikhalazo.

eng: The SCA dismissed the application for leave to appeal on the grounds that there is no reasonable prospect of success and there is no other compelling reason why an appeal should be heard.
xho: I-SCA isikhabile isicelo semvume yokubhena ngesizathu sokuba akukho themba libambekayo lokuphumelela kwaye asikho esinye isizathu esibambekayo sokuba kutheni isibheno kufuneka simanyelwe.

eng: The spokesman of the Jacob Zuma Foundation, Mzwanele Manyi told a press briefing that Zuma's instructions to his legal team to institute private prosecution "will now be put into operation in the next few days."
xho: Isithethi seJacob Zuma Foundation, uMzwanele Manyi, uxelele indibano yonondaba ukuba imiyalelo kaZuma kwiqela lakhe lezomthetho ukuba liqalise ukutshutshisa labucala “iza kuqala ukusebenza kwezi ntsuku zimbalwa zizayo.

eng: He also said Zuma's legal team has filed a reconsideration application to the president of the SCA, a petition to hear the appeal.
xho: Ukwathe igqiza lamagqwetha kaZuma lifake isicelo sokuphinda siqwalaselwe kumongameli weSCA, uxwebhu lwezikhalazo zokumamela isibheno.

eng: Zuma, who was ousted from the ruling African National Congress in 2018 after nearly two decades as president, has pleaded not guilty to charges of corruption, money laundering and racketeering in the long-running case over the $2 billion arms deal in the 1990s.
xho: UZuma, owagxothwayo kumbutho olawulayo we-African National Congress ngo-2018 emva kweminyaka engamashumi amabini engumongameli, uzikhanyelanga izityholo zobuqhophololo, ukurhwaphiliza imali kunye norhwaphilizo kwityala ekudala ligquba malunga nesivumelwano sezixhobo ezixabisa iibhiliyoni ezimbini zeerandi kwiminyaka yoo-1990.

eng: The deal case has dogged Zuma since he was sacked as deputy president of the country in 2005. He said he was the victim of a political witch-hunt.
xho: Ityala lesivumelwano limphethe kakubi uZuma ukusukela oko wagxothwa njengosekela mongameli welizwe ngo-2005. Wathi wayelixhoba lokuzingelwa kwamagqwirha kwezopolitiko.

eng: On Monday the long-delayed trail is set to get underway and Zuma will be present in court.
xho: NgoMvulo lo ukuxoxwa kwetyala okusele kulibazisile kuzokuqala kwaye uZuma uzakube ekhona enkundleni.

eng: Manyi said Zuma, who turns 80 on Tuesday, is applying for a postponement because "it is very clear that the conditions for a fair trail are non-existent."
xho: UManyi uthe uZuma, nogqiba iminyaka engamashumi asibhozo ubudala ngoLwesibini, ufaka isicelo sokumiswa ngenxa yokuba “kucace gca ukuba iimeko zokuxoxwa kwetyala ngokufanelekileyo azikho.

eng: On Monday his team will also respond to the supplementary affidavit served by the National Prosecution Authority where they seek to introduce new evidence in the trial.
xho: NgoMvulo iqela lakhe liza kuphendula kwakhona kwingxelo efungelweyo eyongeziweyo enikwe nguGunyaziwe woTshutshiso weSizwe apho bafuna ukwazisa ubungqina obutsha kwityala.

eng: All His Excellency President Zuma really wants is his day in court, in a fair trial and certainly not in a forum which is being rigged by the State," Manyi said.
xho: “Eyona nto ifunwa nguMongameli uZuma yimini yakhe enkundleni, kuxoxwe ngokungenamkhethe hayi kwiqonga eliqhathwa nguRhulumente,” utshilo uManyi.

eng: South Africa’s Neutral Stance on Russia Risks International Ties: Analysts
xho: UBume boMzantsi Afrika bokungathathi cala kwiRussia bubeka umngcipheko wobudlelwane babazwe ngamazwe: abahlalutyi

eng: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Monday defended his neutral stance on Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling for talks — not condemnation.
xho: Umongameli woMzantsi Afrika uCyril Ramaphosa ngoMvulo ukhusele ukungathabathi cala kwakhe kuhlaselo lwase-Ukraine yiRussia, ememelela iingxoxo- hayi ukugxeka.

eng: Critics have blasted the government for failing to support Ukraine against its neighbor.
xho: Abagxeki baye bagxeka urhulumente ngokusilela ukuxhasa iUkraine ngokuchasene nommelwane wayo.

eng: Analysts say South Africa is allowing historic political and economic ties with Moscow to risk relations with the rest of the world.
xho: Abahlalutyi bathi uMzantsi Afrika uvumela ubudlelwane bezopolitiko nezoqoqosho neMoscow bubeke emngciphekweni ubudlelwane nehlabathi liphela.

eng: Negotiation rather than weapons or economic pressure is the mechanism Ramaphosa would like to see used to settle the Russia-Ukraine conflict.
xho: Uthethathethwano endaweni yezixhobo okanye uxinzelelo lwezoqoqosho yindlela uRamaphosa angathanda ukuyibona isetyenziselwa ukulungisa impixano yaseRussia-neUkraine.

eng: Ramaphosas unwavering stance overruled an earlier call by the countrys international relations department for Russia to withdraw its forces.
xho: Ukungaguquguquki kukaRamaphosa kwasikhaba isicelo sangaphambili sesebe lezobudlelwane bezizwe ngezizwe sokuba iRussia mayirhoxise imikhosi yayo.

eng: Leaza Jernberg is a Johannesburg-based independent researcher and consultant on diplomacy.
xho: ULeaza Jernberg ngumphandi ozimeleyo oseRhawutini kunye nomcebisi kwidiplomacy.

eng: The Department of International Relations and Cooperation, [which] is largely the diplomat for South Africa, their initial instinct was to say, ‘Well, this was not acceptable.
